admin/managing_users_teams/about_veracod.title: about_veracode_accounts
admin/managing_users_teams/about_veracod.description: Veracode provides two account types: a user account, for real human users, and an API service account, for non-human users.

admin/managing_users_teams/administering.title: administering_veracode_account
admin/managing_users_teams/administering.description: Users with the Administrator role can manage users, teams, business units, and eLearning features through the Veracode Platform. To be granted the Administrator role, contact Veracode Technical Support.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.title: create_team_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.description: You can also create a team with the Veracode Identity APIs.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.title: delete_team_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.description: You can only delete a team that has no applications associated with it.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.title: README
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.description: You can use a team to grant users access to applications. You can assign an application to a team when you create the application profile or when viewing details of the application. Administrators can assign users to teams to access applications. If you are a Team administrator, you can only manage users who belong to your team.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.title: update_team_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.description: You can also update a team with the Veracode Identity APIs.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.title: video_create_manage_users_teams
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_team.description: Watch this short video to learn how to create and manage users and teams in the Veracode Platform.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: create_new_user_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: You create a new user on the Administration page in the Veracode Platform. The account type can be a user account or API service account.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: managing_api_users
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: You can configure two types of user accounts that can access the Veracode APIs: user accounts and API service accounts.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: README
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: This section explains user settings, user administration, and how to create new users of the Veracode Platform, Veracode APIs, and integrations.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: remove_user_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: There are two ways to remove user access from the system. You can temporarily deactivate the user using the Login Enabled field, or you can permanently delete a user from the Veracode Platform.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: request_user_email_verification
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: You can request that users verify the email address for their user accounts to improve security of their accounts and allow them to access the Veracode Community directly from the Veracode Platform.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: reset_user_password
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: Users can have their passwords reset by requesting a password reset at the Veracode Platform log in screen, or by having an Administrator issue a password reset email.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: restrict_user_ip_range
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: You can restrict a user so that they can only log in from a machine within a predefined IP address range.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: update_user_platform
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: You can update an account for an existing user. The account type can be a user account or API service account.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: video_create_manage_api_users
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: Watch this video to learn how to configure an API service account in the Veracode Platform.

admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.title: view_activity_log
admin/managing_users_teams/managing_user.description: As an administrator, you can view a log of user activity for the users that you manage.

admin/platform_administration/about_emai.title: about_email_notifications
admin/platform_administration/about_emai.description: Veracode emails notifications about your scans and other important information.

admin/platform_administration/access_lic.title: access_license_consumption_reports
admin/platform_administration/access_lic.description: The Veracode Platform provides four reports that provide consumption data associated with your Veracode licenses: the License Used Report, Largest Scan Report, the All Scans Report, and the License Used Tier Model report. These reports track scan activity that uses your licenses for Veracode Static Analysis and Dynamic Analysis.

admin/platform_administration/add_applic.title: add_applications_bulk
admin/platform_administration/add_applic.description: You can bulk-add a list of applications in XML format to quickly populate your application portfolio. If you have the Security Lead role, you can use the Bulk Add Applications functionality to upload an XML file that lists all the details for all the applications. If you prefer, you can also use the Excel template provided to list all your bulk information, but you must save the file as XML.

admin/platform_administration/add_busine.title: add_business_unit
admin/platform_administration/add_busine.description: Creating business units can help you identify the teams to which you should add new users and manage reporting for Veracode findings.

admin/platform_administration/applicatio.title: application_profile_characters
admin/platform_administration/applicatio.description: When creating an application profile, the values in each field must not exceed the character limit.

admin/platform_administration/assign_app.title: assign_application_teams
admin/platform_administration/assign_app.description: You can specify one or more teams that can access an application and its scan results when you create or edit an application profile.

admin/platform_administration/checking_s.title: calling_status_services_endpoint
admin/platform_administration/checking_s.description: You can call an endpoint to retrieve the status information on this status page//status.veracode.com/.

admin/platform_administration/checking_s.title: README
admin/platform_administration/checking_s.description: You can view the availability status of Veracode services to understand if there are any outages that may impact your ability to access the Veracode Platform and other Veracode sites.

admin/platform_administration/configure_.title: optional_policy_notifications
admin/platform_administration/configure_.description: You can subscribe to notifications for specific events that impact your policies to receive the emails listed in these tables.

admin/platform_administration/configure_.title: optional_scan_notifications
admin/platform_administration/configure_.description: You can unsubscribe from notifications for specific scan types to stop receiving the emails listed in these tables.

admin/platform_administration/configure_.title: README
admin/platform_administration/configure_.description: Using the notification settings of your Veracode Platform account, you can subscribe to or unsubscribe from specific notifications based on scan type and policy event.

admin/platform_administration/create_new.title: create_new_application_profile
admin/platform_administration/create_new.description: You must create an application profile before you can submit a scan to Veracode.

admin/platform_administration/custom_cle.title: custom_cleanser_administration
admin/platform_administration/custom_cle.description: Security Leads can specify the default mitigation state for flaws with custom cleansers.

admin/platform_administration/delete_app.title: delete_application_profile
admin/platform_administration/delete_app.description: You can delete an application profile to permanently deletes its data from your Veracode account.

admin/platform_administration/delete_bus.title: delete_business_unit
admin/platform_administration/delete_bus.description: You can delete any business unit from your organization.

admin/platform_administration/edit_appli.title: edit_application_profile
admin/platform_administration/edit_appli.description: You can edit the data in the application profile at any point in the scan process.

admin/platform_administration/edit_busin.title: edit_business_unit
admin/platform_administration/edit_busin.description: You can edit the name of the business unit or update the list of teams assigned to the business unit.

admin/platform_administration/managing_a.title: managing_application_profiles
admin/platform_administration/managing_a.description: The application profile describes your application, identifies the policy to evaluate the application with, and provides metadata that enables a thorough analysis of security performance across all the applications in your organization.

admin/platform_administration/remove_ema.title: remove_email_veracode_blocklist
admin/platform_administration/remove_ema.description: Veracode sends notifications to your email address for policy events and scan status updates relevant to your role and team membership. If three consecutive attempts to deliver these emails to you fail, Veracode blocklists your email address. If you want to continue receiving these emails from Veracode, you can remove your address from the blocklist.

admin/platform_administration/turn_off_o.title: turn_off_optional_notifications
admin/platform_administration/turn_off_o.description: You can turn off notifications for all users in your organization to limit the number of Veracode emails they receive. You cannot undo this action at the organization level.

admin/platform_administration/understand.title: understanding_license_consumption_reports
admin/platform_administration/understand.description: The license consumption reports in the Veracode Platform provide consumption data associated with your Veracode licenses. Each report provides different details about the Static Analysis and Dynamic Analysis scan activity that uses your license.

admin/platform_administration/video_crea.title: video_create_new_application_profile
admin/platform_administration/video_crea.description: Watch this video to learn how to create a new application profile in the Veracode Platform.

admin/platform_administration/view_appli.title: view_application_profile
admin/platform_administration/view_appli.description: The application profile provides details about policies, scans, sandboxes, findings, and reports for your application.

admin/signing_on/common_roles_user_accou.title: common_roles_user_accounts
admin/signing_on/common_roles_user_accou.description: This table provides examples of roles you might want to apply to Veracode user accounts in your organization.

admin/signing_on/jit_provisioning_migrat.title: migrate_to_jit_provisioning_sso
admin/signing_on/jit_provisioning_migrat.description: You must work with Veracode Support and your identity provider (IdP) to migrate your organization to the new Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time (JIT) Provisioning feature.

admin/signing_on/jit_provisioning_migrat.title: README
admin/signing_on/jit_provisioning_migrat.description: In July 2022, Veracode introduced the Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time (JIT) Provisioning feature. Because of changes in the SSO settings, there are steps you must perform to migrate to the new feature. Some benefits of the new feature include:

admin/signing_on/README.title: README
admin/signing_on/README.description: Note: You must access the Veracode Platform using the appropriate domain for your region.

admin/signing_on/understanding_api_roles.title: understanding_api_roles
admin/signing_on/understanding_api_roles.description: This section describes the non-API user roles that your user account must have before you can use the APIs to automate specific tasks.

admin/signing_on/understanding_user_role.title: understanding_user_roles_permissions
admin/signing_on/understanding_user_role.description: This section provides details about the permissions available to each role on the Veracode Platform. To see which roles are often relevant to different users in your organization, see Common Roles for User Accounts.

admin/signing_on/using_saml_self_registr.description: Note:  If you are using the new Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time Provisioning feature, see Configure JIT Provisioning.

admin/signing_on/using_saml_self_registr.description: Note:  If you are using the new Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time Provisioning feature, see Using SAML for JIT Provisioning.

admin/signing_on/using_saml_self_registr.title: README
admin/signing_on/using_saml_self_registr.description: You can use Just-In-Time (JIT) provisioning to provision new users or update existing user records.

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml_legacy/c.description: Note:  If you are using the new Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time Provisioning feature, see Configuring Your Organization Account for SAML.

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml_legacy/R.description: Note:  If you are using the new Single Sign-on and Just-In-Time Provisioning feature, see Using Single Sign-On with SAML.

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.title: configuring_organization_account_saml
admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.description: Contact Veracode Technical Support to enable your organization account to use SAML for single sign-on. After enabling SAML for your organization, users with the Administrator role for your organization see a SAML tab on the Administration page.

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.title: configuring_organization_idp_saml
admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.description: While identity provider technologies vary, most require some information about the Veracode Platform to know how to properly construct and forward the SAML assertion. This information should be configured in your identity provider (IdP):

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.title: configuring_user_saml_access
admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/configur.description: Using SAML authentication requires that a user account has a user record in the Veracode Platform.

admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/README.title: README
admin/signing_on/using_sso_saml/README.description: You can enable users in your organization to use single sign-on and configure SAML access for users.

Analytics/about_dashboards.description: From Analytics \> Veracode Dashboards, visualizations are available to help you understand the security status of your application and how your organization uses the Veracode Platform.

Analytics/customize_dashboards.title: customize_dashboards
Analytics/customize_dashboards.description: You can modify existing filters to view different points of data to change what information is displayed.

Analytics/customize_visualizations/analy.title: analytics_video_organizations_dashboards
Analytics/customize_visualizations/analy.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to create and save a personal dashboard in the Veracode Platform.

Analytics/customize_visualizations/READM.title: README
Analytics/customize_visualizations/READM.description: You can customize the elements, called visualizations, in a chart if you want to change how data is displayed. You have the ability to modify many visual elements including colors, labels, and chart types.

Analytics/save_dashboards/analytics_embe.title: analytics_embed_video_personal_dashboards
Analytics/save_dashboards/analytics_embe.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to create and save a dashboard to share with your team in My Organization's Dashboards.

Analytics/save_dashboards/README.title: README
Analytics/save_dashboards/README.description: You can save modified dashboards and visualizations to view later and share with other users.

Analytics/using_explore/applications_exp.description: The following definitions describe the dimensions and measures used on the applications explore in Veracode Analytics.

Analytics/using_explore/findings_explore.description: The following definitions describe the dimensions and measures in the Findings explore in Veracode Analytics.

apis/about_apis/about_api_access.title: about_api_access
apis/about_apis/about_api_access.description: To be able to access the Veracode APIs, you must have a Veracode account with the required roles for performing specific tasks with the APIs.

apis/about_apis/api_prerequisites.title: api_prerequisites
apis/about_apis/api_prerequisites.description: The XML APIs, REST APIs, and API wrappers have specific prerequisites. but there are general guidelines that apply to all APIs.

apis/about_apis/api_rate_limiting.title: api_rate_limiting
apis/about_apis/api_rate_limiting.description: To ensure optimal performance and availability of Veracode services to all users, Veracode reserves the right to limit API requests.

apis/about_apis/README.title: README
apis/about_apis/README.description: The Veracode REST and XML APIs mirror the main tasks for scanning applications, reviewing results, mitigating findings, and administrating your organization in the Veracode Platform. Veracode strongly recommends that you use the REST APIs. For new integrations, always use the REST APIs.

apis/api_best_practices/README.title: README
apis/api_best_practices/README.description: The Veracode APIs allow you to perform and automate security testing tasks you perform in the Veracode Platform and with Veracode integrations. The best practices in this section help you avoid performance issues for your automations.

apis/api_wrappers/install_csharp_wrapper.title: install_csharp_wrapper
apis/api_wrappers/install_csharp_wrapper.description: You download the C# wrapper as a ZIP archive from Veracode, extract the installer from the archive and, then, run the installer from the command line.

apis/api_wrappers/README.title: README
apis/api_wrappers/README.description: Veracode provides API wrappers for Java and C# to simplify the integration of the XML APIs.

apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/jav.title: java_wrapper_config_params
apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/jav.description: You can configure the API wrapper parameters to specify your Veracode API credentials, the actions to perform, and to add parameters.

apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/jav.title: java_wrapper_verify_authenticity
apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/jav.description: Each Java artifact in the Java API wrapper is associated with an ASC signature file for verifying that the publication source is Veracode. You can download the ASC file for the appropriate version of the Java wrapper.

apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/REA.title: README
apis/api_wrappers/setup_java_wrapper/REA.description: You can download the Java API wrapper from Maven Central or obtain it as a container image from Docker Hub.

apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/R.title: README
apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/R.description: You can use the Veracode API wrappers as a library, which enables you to call API functions without having to set up web requests and look up the required URL or query string parameters.

apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/r.title: reference_csharp_wrapper_visual_studio
apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/r.description: You can reference the C# API wrapper as a library from Visual Studio. Adding the wrapper as a library enables you to call API functions without having to set up web requests and look up the required URL or query string parameters.

apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/r.title: reference_java_wrapper_eclipse
apis/api_wrappers/use_wrappers_library/r.description: You can reference the Java API wrapper as a library from Eclipse. Adding the wrapper as a library enables you to call API functions without having to set up web requests and look up the required URL or query string parameters.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.title: api_wrapper_parameters
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.description: Most actions in the Veracode Java and C# API wrappers expose required or optional parameters. Some parameters apply to every action that the wrapper supports.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.title: api_wrapper_run_command_line
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.description: You can run the Java or C# API wrapper from a command line.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.title: README
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_command_line/.description: The Veracode XML APIs allow you to access Veracode and perform actions such as creating application profiles, uploading files, starting scans, and downloading reports. You can interact with the APIs programmatically or through a web browser.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: alldetailedreports
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: The alldetailedreports composite action downloads the detailed report for the latest build of each application for the specified user account.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: passfail
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: The passfail composite action retrieves the latest detailed report for the application with the specified appname parameter. It prints to the console the name of the submitter, the latest build, and the policy compliance status of the scan.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: README
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: A composite action corresponds to calls to multiple Veracode XML APIs to accomplish a specific workflow.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: switchtosaml
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: The switchtosaml composite action calls getuserlist.do. It searches users on the list whose issamluser parameter is not set to true and whose loginaccounttype parameter is not api. The action then changes the issamluser parameter to true for those users. The parameter customid or username is required.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: uploadandscan
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: The uploadandscan composite action enables you to upload files to Veracode for scanning.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.title: uploadandscanbyappid
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_composite_act.description: The uploadandscanbyappid composite action enables you to upload files to Veracode for scanning.

apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_use_simple_ac.title: wrappers_use_simple_actions
apis/api_wrappers/wrappers_use_simple_ac.description: A simple action is a single call to one of the Veracode XML APIs.

apis/api_wrappers/xml_wrappers_creds_fil.title: xml_wrappers_creds_file
apis/api_wrappers/xml_wrappers_creds_fil.description: You can use a Veracode API credentials file to provide your Veracode API credentials to the Veracode API wrappers.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_java_hmac/.title: hmac_signing_example_java
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_java_hmac/.description: This is a Java example of how to enable HMAC signing within your application. The example implementation of the HMAC signing algorithm allows you to authenticate with the Veracode APIs.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_java_hmac/.title: README
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_java_hmac/.description: If you want to use the Veracode APIs with a Java application, you must download and install the Java authentication library.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.title: hmac_signing_example_python
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.description: Veracode provides a Python library you can use to enable HMAC signing within your application. By default, the Python authentication library assumes you store your API credentials in an API credentials file or that you pass the credentials with environment variables. Veracode highly recommends you use an API credentials file.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.title: hmac_use_httpie_with_python
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.description: The Veracode APIs require that you enable HMAC authentication for your Python application as a security measure for accessing API resources. The Python authentication library provides an integration between HTTPie and the Veracode APIs, which adds HMAC authentication when using the Veracode APIs from the command line.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.title: prepare_ubuntu_for_python
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.description: Before installing the Python authentication library on Ubuntu, Veracode recommends that you run these commands to prepare the system:

apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.title: README
apis/apis_hmac_auth/configure_python_hma.description: You can install the Python authentication library from the Python Package Index \(PyPI\) or obtain it as a container image from Docker Hub. The library enables HMAC authentication, which is a required security measure for using the Veracode APIs with your Python applications.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/hmac_signing_example.title: hmac_signing_example_csharp
apis/apis_hmac_auth/hmac_signing_example.description: This is a C# example of how to enable HMAC signing within your application shows how to authenticate when using the Veracode APIs.

apis/apis_hmac_auth/hmac_troubleshoot.title: hmac_troubleshoot
apis/apis_hmac_auth/hmac_troubleshoot.description: Issues that prevent HMAC from working correctly, or make it appear that HMAC is not working at all, include:

apis/apis_hmac_auth/README.title: README
apis/apis_hmac_auth/README.description: Veracode APIs use a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) with your Veracode API credentials to add an HMAC signature to the HTTP authorization header of each API request. This security measure provides maximum protection against man-in-the-middle and session replay attacks.

apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.description: Use this command to approve a mitigation proposal, with a comment, for an application with two findings:

apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.title: annotations_api_comment_on_findings
apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.description: Veracode does not include comments in scan reports, so your comments are private to you and your team.

apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.title: annotations_api_propose_mitigation
apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.description: Use this command to propose a mitigation, based on an environmental control in the network, with a comment, for an application with two findings:

apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/anno.description: Use this command to reject a mitigation proposal, with a comment, for an application with two findings:

apis/rest_apis/annotations_rest_api/READ.description: You can use the Veracode Annotations API to annotate findings, including adding comments and proposing, accepting, and rejecting mitigations.

apis/rest_apis/applications_rest_api/app.description: Use this command to create an application:

This impacts application profiles that you have linked to agent-based scanning projects.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/createteam_.title: createteam_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/createteam_.description: The createteam.do call creates a new team of users.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/createuser_.title: createuser_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/createuser_.description: The createuser.do call creates a new user account. You must be logged into a API service account to create a user account with this call. To create a API service account, you must use the Veracode Platform or the Identity REST API.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/deleteteam_.title: deleteteam_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/deleteteam_.description: The deleteteam.do call deletes a specified team.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/deleteuser_.title: deleteuser_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/deleteuser_.description: The deleteuser.do call deletes a user account. To delete a API service account, you must use the Veracode Platform or the Identity REST API.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getcurricul.title: getcurriculumlist_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getcurricul.description: The getcurriculumlist.do call returns a list of the Veracode eLearning curricula defined for your organization.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getmaintena.title: getmaintenancescheduleinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getmaintena.description: The getmaintenancescheduleinfo.do call requests the upcoming Veracode Platform maintenance schedule. Plan to pause scheduled API activity during the downtime to avoid automation failures.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getteaminfo.title: getteaminfo_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getteaminfo.description: The getteaminfo.do call returns information about a specific team.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getteamlist.title: getteamlist_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getteamlist.description: The getteamlist.do call returns a list of the user teams in your organization.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/gettracklis.title: gettracklist_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/gettracklis.description: The gettracklist.do call returns a list of the Veracode eLearning tracks that are available for your organization.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getuserinfo.title: getuserinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getuserinfo.description: The getuserinfo.do call returns information about the specified user.

apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getuserlist.title: getuserlist_do
apis/xml_apis/admin_xml_apis/getuserlist.description: The getuserlist.do call returns a list of the Veracode accounts in your organization.
