apis/xml_apis/flaw_report_xml_apis/flaw_.description: This table lists the XML API calls for managing flaw reports. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apis/xml_apis/flaw_report_xml_apis/gener.title: generateflawreport_do
apis/xml_apis/flaw_report_xml_apis/gener.description: The generateflawreport.do creates a report listing all fixed and unfixed flaws for the specified applications, scan types, or both. The return contains the token needed for downloading the flaw report.

apis/xml_apis/flaw_report_xml_apis/READM.title: README
apis/xml_apis/flaw_report_xml_apis/READM.description: The Flaw Report API has two calls that enable you to generate and download a summarized history of all findings for one, several, or all applications.

apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/getmit.title: getmitigationinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/getmit.description: The getmitigationinfo.do call retrieves all action information for listed flaws in the specified build.

apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/mitiga.title: mitigation_xml_apis_quickref
apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/mitiga.description: This table lists the XML API calls for mitigating and commenting on findings. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/README.description: The Mitigation and Comments API enables you to integrate comments on findings and mitigation workflow tasks into IDEs and bug tracking systems.

apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/update.title: updatemitigationinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/update.description: The updatemitigationinfo.do call enables you to perform several actions on a list of one or more flaws in the specified build. These actions include commenting on a flaw, proposing a mitigation action, and rejecting or accepting a mitigation action.

apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/xml_ap.title: xml_api_mitigation_tutorial
apis/xml_apis/mitigation_xml_apis/xml_ap.description: This tutorial steps you through using the Mitigation and Comments API. This guide uses standalone HTTP request calls, but you can combine them in an API wrapper to process multiple API calls.

apis/xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/README.description: Veracode provides both XML and REST APIs for automating application security testing tasks. The XML APIs are also available as wrappers. Veracode strongly recommends that you use the REST APIs. For new integrations, always use the REST APIs.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/detailedr.title: detailedreport_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/detailedr.description: The detailedreport.do call returns a detailed XML report of all scan results related to the specified build.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/detailedr.title: detailedreportpdf_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/detailedr.description: The detailedreportpdf.do call downloads a PDF report of the detailed scan results for the specified build.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getaccoun.title: getaccountcustomfieldlist_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getaccoun.description: The getaccountcustomfieldlist.do call returns the ID and name of the available custom fields for your organization. You must have the Results API role to be able to use this API.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getappbui.title: getappbuilds_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getappbui.description: The getappbuilds.do call compiles a detailed list of applications and statuses, including all the application and scan profile data.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getcallst.title: getcallstacks_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/getcallst.description: The getcallstacks.do call retrieves the call stacks for a specified flaw in a specific build.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/README.description: You can use the Veracode Results API to access your application assessment data from another application or a script.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/results_a.title: results_api_mapping_tasks
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/results_a.description: The Results API automates scan submissions and report retrieval.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/results_x.title: results_xml_apis_quickref
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/results_x.description: This table lists the XML API calls for managing scan results. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/summaryre.title: summaryreport_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/summaryre.description: The summaryreport.do call returns a summary XML report of the scan results for the specified build.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/summaryre.title: summaryreportpdf_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/summaryre.description: The summaryreportpdf.do call downloads a PDF summary report of the scan results for the specified build.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/thirdpart.title: thirdpartyreportpdf_do
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/thirdpart.description: The thirdpartyreportpdf.do call downloads a PDF file of the scan results for the specified build of a third-party application.

apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/xml_api_r.title: xml_api_results_tutorial
apis/xml_apis/results_xml_apis/xml_api_r.description: This tutorial provides basic step-by-step information on how to use the Veracode Results API to automate the retrieval of application scan results using the HTTPie command-line tool. This guide uses standalone HTTP request calls, but you can combine them in an API wrapper to process multiple API calls.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/createsan.title: createsandbox_do
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/createsan.description: The createsandbox.do call creates a sandbox for the specified application. If you have already reached the maximum number of sandboxes for the application, this call fails.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/deletesan.title: deletesandbox_do
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/deletesan.description: The deletesandbox.do call deletes the specified sandbox.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/getsandbo.title: getsandboxlist_do
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/getsandbo.description: The getsandboxlist.do call returns the list of sandboxes associated with the specified application.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/promotesa.title: promotesandbox_do
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/promotesa.description: If the specified sandbox build scans successfully, the promotesandbox.do call promotes the build to be the policy scan for the application.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/README.description: You can use the Sandbox XML API calls to create, list, promote, update, and delete development sandboxes.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/sandbox_x.title: sandbox_xml_apis_quickref
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/sandbox_x.description: This table lists the XML API calls for managing development sandboxes. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/updatesan.title: updatesandbox_do
apis/xml_apis/sandbox_xml_apis/updatesan.description: The updatesandbox.do call allows you to update the custom field values for the specified sandbox.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/beginpresc.title: beginprescan_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/beginpresc.description: The beginprescan.do call runs the prescan of the application.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/beginscan_.title: beginscan_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/beginscan_.description: The beginscan.do call runs a full scan of the application. Specify the application ID and one of the four scan-type parameters.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/createapp_.title: createapp_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/createapp_.description: The createapp.do call creates a new application profile in the portfolio.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/createbuil.title: createbuild_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/createbuil.description: The createbuild.do call creates a new build of an existing application in the portfolio.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/deleteapp_.title: deleteapp_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/deleteapp_.description: The deleteapp.do call deletes an existing application in the portfolio.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/deletebuil.title: deletebuild_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/deletebuil.description: The deletebuild.do call deletes the most recent static build of an existing application in the portfolio.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getappinfo.title: getappinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getappinfo.description: The getappinfo.do call provides information about the application.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getapplist.title: getapplist_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getapplist.description: The getapplist.do call compiles a list of the applications in the portfolio. If you use the optional parameter to include user information, this call also returns details about tasks you have permissions to perform, such as view scan results and approve mitigations.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getbuildin.title: getbuildinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getbuildin.description: The getbuildinfo.do call provides information about the most recent scan or a specific scan of the application.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getbuildli.title: getbuildlist_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getbuildli.description: The getbuildlist.do call produces a list of the application policy or sandbox scans in progress or already complete.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getfilelis.title: getfilelist_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getfilelis.description: The getfilelist.do call compiles a list of files uploaded for a static scan. The returned XML provides MD5 checksums for these files if available.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getpolicyl.title: getpolicylist_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getpolicyl.description: The getpolicylist.do call compiles a list of policies available to your account.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getprescan.title: getprescanresults_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getprescan.description: The getprescanresults.do call fetches the results of the prescan.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getvendorl.title: getvendorlist_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/getvendorl.description: The getvendorlist.do call compiles a list of your organization vendors for third-party scans.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/README.description: You can use the Veracode Upload API to create an application, upload binary modules, check prescan results, and submit a static scan request.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/removefile.title: removefile_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/removefile.description: The removefile.do call deletes a file from an existing application build.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/updateapp_.title: updateapp_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/updateapp_.description: The updateapp.do call modifies the settings of an existing application in the portfolio.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/updatebuil.title: updatebuild_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/updatebuil.description: The updatebuild.do call updates the most recent build of an existing application in the portfolio. To update an earlier build, specify the build_id parameter.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/upload_api.title: upload_api_mapping_tasks
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/upload_api.description: To understand how the Upload API works and in which order you use the Upload API calls, this table maps the API calls to the manual steps in the Veracode Platform.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/upload_xml.title: upload_xml_apis_quickref
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/upload_xml.description: This table lists the XML API calls for managing scans of your applications. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/uploadfile.title: uploadfile_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/uploadfile.description: The uploadfile.do call uploads a file to an existing build or creates a build. Veracode recommends that you use the uploadlargefile.do call to avoid timeout errors when uploading a large file.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/uploadlarg.title: uploadlargefile_do
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/uploadlarg.description: The uploadlargefile.do call uploads a single file as a set of parts to an existing build or creates a build. Uploading the file in parts avoids timeout errors, which can occur when uploading a large file using the uploadfile.do call.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_bu.title: xml_api_buildinfo_table
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_bu.description: This table describes the scan statuses for the XML APIs.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_pr.title: xml_api_prescan_status
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_pr.description: The getprescanresults.do call returns the prescanresults.xml file. This file contains three types of information about any issues with your uploaded files and modules.

apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_up.title: xml_api_upload_tutorial
apis/xml_apis/upload_xml_apis/xml_api_up.description: This tutorial steps you through using the Upload XML API to automate the scanning of an application using the HTTPie command-line tool. This guide uses standalone HTTP request calls, but you can combine them in an API wrapper to run multiple API calls.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/getsharedrep.title: getsharedreportinfo_do
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/getsharedrep.description: The getsharedreportinfo.do call returns information about a specific shared report or the latest shared report.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/getsharedrep.title: getsharedreportlist_do
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/getsharedrep.description: The getsharedreportlist.do call returns a list of published shared reports that are linked to the application.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/README.title: README
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/README.description: The Vendor Application Security Testing (VAST) program has XML APIs for generating vendor and enterprise reports.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/sharedreport.title: sharedreport_do
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/sharedreport.description: The sharedreport.do call returns the details of a shared report.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/sharedreport.title: sharedreportpdf_do
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/sharedreport.description: The sharedreportpdf.do call returns the shared report as a PDF document to the specified directory.

apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/vast_xml_api.title: vast_xml_apis_quickref
apis/xml_apis/vast_xml_apis/vast_xml_api.description: This table lists the XML API calls for getting Vendor Application Security Testing (VAST) reports. For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

apisec/apisec_about_specs.title: apisec_about_specs
apisec/apisec_about_specs.description: Veracode API Scanning supports API specification files in OpenAPI 2.0 (Swagger), OpenAPI 3.0, and HTTP Archive (HAR) format. An OpenAPI specification must be valid YAML or JSON.

apisec/apisec_config.title: apisec_config
apisec/apisec_config.description: After creating an API specification scan in the Veracode Platform, you need to configure the scan with specific settings, such as the target API server, the server authentication method, and, if the server is behind a firewall, an Internal Scan Management (ISM) gateway.

apisec/apisec_intro.title: apisec_intro
apisec/apisec_intro.description: You use API Scanning to perform a Dynamic Analysis of one or more API specifications. The analysis tests the security of the API endpoints in the specification and returns scan results with discovered security findings.

apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_p.title: apisec_prescan_results
apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_p.description: In the Veracode Platform, you can review prescan results of your scanned API specifications. The prescan results indicate whether Veracode successfully reached and, if required, authenticated with the target server for each API endpoint included in the scan.

apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_v.title: apisec_video_prescan_results
apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_v.description: Watch the following video to learn how to review Dynamic Analysis prescan results for an API specification.

apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_v.title: apisec_video_scan_results
apisec/apisec_reviewing_results/apisec_v.description: Watch the following video to learn how to review Dynamic Analysis scan results for an API specification.

apisec/create_scan/apisec_create_scan.title: apisec_create_scan
apisec/create_scan/apisec_create_scan.description: You can create an API specification scan in the Veracode Platform to perform a Dynamic Analysis of all endpoints in one or more API specifications.

apisec/create_scan/apisec_fix_relative_u.title: apisec_fix_relative_urls
apisec/create_scan/apisec_fix_relative_u.description: API Scanning requires the absolute, or base, URL at which the API you want to scan is hosted. It checks for this URL when you upload an API specification to the Veracode Platform. If API Scanning cannot determine this URL from the uploaded specification, you see an error with a field to enter the fully-qualified URL. Enter the base URL for your API.

apisec/create_scan/video_create_api_scan.title: video_create_api_scan
apisec/create_scan/video_create_api_scan.description: Watch the following video to learn how to create an API specification scan. This scan performs a Dynamic Analysis of the API specification to test the security of all contained endpoints.

apisec/create_scan/video_manage_api_spec.title: video_manage_api_specifications
apisec/create_scan/video_manage_api_spec.description: Watch the following video to learn how to upload, update, and delete API specifications using the API Specification Management tab in the Veracode Platform. This tab is a feature of Dynamic Analysis API Scanning.

build_systems/ant_integration/integrate_.title: integrate_ant
build_systems/ant_integration/integrate_.description: You can add the Java API wrapper to your Ant build server to integrate Static Analysis in your Ant build process. When using Ant to build Java applications, the API wrapper uploads your Java source code to Veracode for scanning.

build_systems/ant_integration/README.title: README
build_systems/ant_integration/README.description: You can use the Veracode Java API wrapper to integrate Veracode Static Analysis with Apache Ant. The integration seamlessly adds static scanning into the existing build processes that you use in your Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.title: aws_configure_codebuild_project_sca
build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.description: You configure a new or existing build project in AWS CodeBuild project that performs Veracode Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\) agent-based scans. You add the build project to a pipeline stage in CodePipeline to analyze the build output from your application build stage.

build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.title: aws_configure_codebuild_project_static
build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.description: You configure a new or existing build project in AWS CodeBuild that includes the Veracode Java API wrapper, your Veracode API credentials, and the Veracode API commands to call for performing static analysis. You add the build project to a pipeline stage in CodePipeline for analyzing the build output from your application build stage.

build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.title: aws_configure_pipeline
build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/a.description: You configure a new or existing pipeline in AWS CodePipeline that includes a build stage for performing Veracode Static Analysis and Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scans of your application build output. These analyses can run in the same stage or different stages, but you must place them in the pipeline after the application build stage.

build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/R.title: README
build_systems/aws_codestar_integration/R.description: You can use Veracode for AWS CodeStar to seamlessly integrate Veracode Static Analysis and Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scans with your Amazon Web Services (AWS) pipelines.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_add_static_build_pipeline
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can use the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension to integrate Veracode Static Analysis into your Azure DevOps and Team Foundation Server \(TFS\) build pipelines.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_uploadscan_yaml_props
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: This table describes the properties and their values for adding the Veracode Upload and Scan task to an Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS) build pipeline using YAML.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: README
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can use YAML to add the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension and integrate Veracode Static Analysis into your Azure DevOps and Team Foundation Server \(TFS\) build pipelines.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_add_static_release_pipeline
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can configure the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension to add the Veracode Upload and Scan task and the Veracode Flaw Importer task to a release pipeline in Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS).

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_check_version
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can check the version of the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension installed on your on-premise Azure DevOps Server or Team Foundation Server (TFS) to determine whether to update the extension manually. For Azure DevOps Services, which are hosted in the cloud, the extension can update to the latest version automatically.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_configure_dotnet_build
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can configure the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension in Visual Studio to scan ASP.NET applications as part of your Azure DevOps build process.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_create_service_connection
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can create a service connection in Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS) for the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension to access Veracode.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.title: azure_hide_proxy_password
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/a.description: You can add a variable in Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS) to hide a proxy password and prevent that password from being shown in console logs of build or release pipelines.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/i.title: install_azure_extension
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/i.description: You can install the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension from the Microsoft Visual Studio Marketplace.

build_systems/azure_devops_integration/R.title: README
build_systems/azure_devops_integration/R.description: You use the Veracode Azure DevOps Extension in build or release pipelines to upload your code to Veracode for scanning. You can configure the extension for either Azure DevOps or on-premise Team Foundation Server (TFS).

build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.title: bamboo_build_maven_project
build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.description: You can use the Veracode Bamboo Integration to build and scan a Maven project with Bamboo.

build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.title: bamboo_create_plan_dotnet_apps
build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.description: You can create a plan for .NET applications using the Veracode Bamboo Integration.

build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.title: bamboo_create_plan_java_apps
build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.description: You can create a plan for Java applications using the Veracode Bamboo Integration.

build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.title: bamboo_submit_app
build_systems/bamboo_integration/bamboo_.description: The Veracode Bamboo Integration enables you to submit applications from your Bamboo environment to Veracode using the Veracode Java API wrapper.

build_systems/bamboo_integration/README.title: README
build_systems/bamboo_integration/README.description: You use the Veracode Java API wrapper to integrate Veracode with your Maven build server. The integration seamlessly adds static scanning into the existing build processes that you use in your Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

build_systems/github_integration/README.title: README
build_systems/github_integration/README.description: You can use Veracode for GitHub to integrate Veracode Static Analysis with GitHub Actions. This integration enables you to automate scanning of your application code from within GitHub.

build_systems/integrating_build_systems.title: integrating_build_systems
build_systems/integrating_build_systems.description: Veracode provides integrations and APIs to enable you to integrate application security with your build servers and release-management processes.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_add_pipeline_static_job_creds_binding
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can add the Veracode Jenkins Plugin to a pipeline job to include Static Analysis in your build pipeline.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_add_static_build_job
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can configure a Jenkins build job in a freestyle or pipeline project for uploading binaries to Veracode for Static Analysis. You continue to use your same build process, but you add a post-build action for the Veracode parameters.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_creds_binding_plugin
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can use the Jenkins Credentials Binding plugin to bind your Veracode API credentials to environment variables in a Jenkins pipeline. You generate a script containing the bound environment variables, then add this script to your Jenkins pipeline script.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_plugin
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: After installing the Veracode Jenkins Plugin, there are required and optional settings you can configure before using the plugin to scan your code.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_install_creds_binding_plugin
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can install the Credentials Binding plugin in Jenkins to store and access your credentials securely.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_uninstall_plugin
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can uninstall the Veracode Jenkins Plugin the same as any other Jenkins plugin.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: README
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can download and install or upgrade the Veracode Jenkins Plugin using the Plugin Manager from within Jenkins. You can also download the plugin from the Jenkins Marketplace and, then, install it using the Plugin Manager.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: video_jenkins_use_creds_binding_plugin
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: Watch this video to learn how to:

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_pipeline_script_params
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: This table describes the parameters and their values for using the Jenkins Plugin in a build script. The script is Apache Groovy.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_prereqs
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: Before you can install and use the Veracode Jenkins Plugin, you must meet these prerequisites and have a Veracode account with the required roles.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_review_static_sca_results
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can choose to display the results of a Veracode Static Analysis and SCA scan in Jenkins for freestyle or pipeline jobs.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_da_resubmit_freestyle
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can add a post-build action to your Jenkins freestyle project that submits your application for Dynamic Analysis.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_da_resubmit_pipeline
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can add a step to your Jenkins pipeline project for performing a Dynamic Analysis of you application.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_da_review_freestyle
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can add a post-build action to your Jenkins freestyle project to get scan results from a Dynamic Analysis of your application.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_da_review_pipeline
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can add a step to your Jenkins pipeline project to get scan results from a Dynamic Analysis of your application.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_configure_global_credentials_freestyle
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can configure the Veracode Jenkins Plugin to use global Veracode API credentials when running a Dynamic Analysis as a post-build action in freestyle builds.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: README
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: You can configure post-build actions, or steps, to have the Veracode Jenkins Plugin perform a Dynamic Analysis of your application and generate a report of the analysis results.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: video_jenkins_configure_da_resubmit_freestyle
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to add post-build actions in your Jenkins freestyle build to resubmit a Veracode Dynamic Analysis and review Dynamic Analysis results from within your freestyle project.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: video_jenkins_configure_da_resubmit_review_pipeline
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to add to post-build actions in your Jenkins pipeline build to resubmit a Veracode Dynamic Analysis and review Dynamic Analysis results from within your pipeline project.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.title: jenkins_using_sandboxes
build_systems/jenkins_integration/jenkin.description: From within Jenkins, you can create a development sandbox into which you upload your files for Veracode scanning. You do this when configuring your Jenkins job.

build_systems/jenkins_integration/README.title: README
build_systems/jenkins_integration/README.description: The Veracode Jenkins Plugin integrates with your Jenkins development pipelines to seamlessly automate the operations for building, uploading, and scanning your application code.

build_systems/maven_integration/integrat.title: integrate_maven
build_systems/maven_integration/integrat.description: You can add the Java API wrapper to your Maven build server to integrate Static Analysis in your Ant build process. When using Ant to build Java applications, the API wrapper uploads your Java source code to Veracode for scanning.

build_systems/maven_integration/README.title: README
build_systems/maven_integration/README.description: You can use the Veracode Java API wrapper to integrate Veracode Static Analysis with Apache Maven. The integration seamlessly adds static scanning into the existing build processes that you use in your Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

build_systems/teamcity_integration/confi.title: config_teamcity_plugin
build_systems/teamcity_integration/confi.description: You can configure TeamCity to customize the integration of the Veracode TeamCity Plugin.

build_systems/teamcity_integration/confi.title: config_teamcity_scan
build_systems/teamcity_integration/confi.description: You can configure TeamCity jobs to upload binaries to Veracode for scanning. When you perform a Veracode scan, you use your same TeamCity build process, but add a build step for the Veracode parameters.

build_systems/teamcity_integration/insta.title: install_teamcity_plugin
build_systems/teamcity_integration/insta.description: You can download the Veracode TeamCity Plugin ZIP file from the JetBrains Marketplace.

build_systems/teamcity_integration/READM.title: README
build_systems/teamcity_integration/READM.description: You can use the Veracode TeamCity Plugin to integrate Veracode security scanning into your build process.

build_systems/teamcity_integration/unins.title: uninstall_teamcity_plugin
build_systems/teamcity_integration/unins.description: You can uninstall the Veracode TeamCity Plugin to remove Veracode scanning from your TeamCity projects.

container/container_commands.title: container_commands
container/container_commands.description: @@@@@@@2 every command uses this format veracode

container/install_container_scanning.title: install_container_scanning
container/install_container_scanning.description: To use Veracode Container Security, you must install the Veracode CLI.

container/review_container_findings.title: review_container_findings
container/review_container_findings.description: After you complete a Veracode Container Security scan, your results appear in your CLI. The results contain security misconfigurations.

Discovery/c_about_discovery.title: c_about_discovery
Discovery/c_about_discovery.description: Discovery scans analyze your web application perimeter and perform focused searches for web applications within a defined IP address range or list of known hosts. In the Veracode Platform, the Discovery scan results provide a detailed list of all discovered applications. This list of applications can help you determine which applications to include in your Dynamic Analysis scans.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/c_ac.title: c_action_items_dd
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/c_ac.description: This topic describes data in the Action Items worksheet included in the Discovery scan extract. Veracode generates this extract after you run a Discovery scan.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_Di.title: r_Discovery_data
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_Di.description: This topic defines the data in the Discovery Data worksheet included in the Discovery scan extract. Veracode generates this extract after you run a Discovery scan. The findings might point to websites previously unknown to you.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_di.title: r_discovery_scan_dashboard
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_di.description: This topic describes the data and graphs in the Dashboard worksheet included in the Discovery scan extract. Veracode generates this extract after you run a Discovery scan.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_do.title: r_domains_need_review_dd
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_do.description: This topic describes the data and graphs in the Domains Needing Review worksheet included in the Discovery scan extract. Veracode generates this extract after you run a Discovery scan.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_dy.title: r_dynamic_mp
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_dy.description: This topic describes the data in the DynamicMP Input worksheet included in the Discovery scan extract. Veracode generates this extract after you run a Discovery scan.

Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_UR.title: r_URL_structures_dd
Discovery/discovery_data_dictionary/r_UR.description: This section describes the elements and concepts for Veracode Discovery scans.

Discovery/t_change_discovery_visibility.title: t_change_discovery_visibility
Discovery/t_change_discovery_visibility.description: You can limit the visibility of the scan results to all Security Leads and specific teams. After a Veracode Discovery scan completes, you can still change who can see the results.

Discovery/t_request_discovery_scan.title: t_request_discovery_scan
Discovery/t_request_discovery_scan.description: You provide a list of domain names and Internet-facing IP address ranges that you want the Discovery scan to search and analyze.

dynamic_analysis/about_da_status/about_d.title: about_da_notifications
dynamic_analysis/about_da_status/about_d.description: Veracode sends email notifications at significant points during the Dynamic Analysis lifecycle.

dynamic_analysis/about_da_status/README.title: README
dynamic_analysis/about_da_status/README.description: You can view Dynamic Analysis scans to verify status updates. All actions and statuses are available in the activity log located at the bottom of the Dynamic Analysis summary page.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: about_dynamic_scan_capacity
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: The scan capacity subscription you purchase from Veracode determines the concurrent scan capacity at which you can perform Dynamic Analysis scans.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: configure_dynamic_web_login_settings
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Veracode can use several authentication methods to access your web application for Dynamic Analysis scanning. You can configure an authentication method in the Veracode Platform.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: configure_dynamic_web_urls
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: In the Veracode Platform, you can configure Dynamic Analysis scan settings for each web application or API specification.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_configure_ism
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: If you want to scan an internal application hosted behind a firewall, you need to select a gateway and endpoint that can reach it.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_selenium_commands
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: This table lists the Selenium commands Veracode supports in sequence scripts. You can upload scripts to a Dynamic Analysis. Your Selenium IDE version might not support all these commands.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_web_auth_recommend
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Veracode Dynamic Analysis supports single sign-on \(SSO\) systems using HTTP basic access authentication and HTML forms-based authentication.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_web_provide_crawl_script
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: To ensure a comprehensive scan of your URL, you can provide Veracode with a crawl script that contains the necessary input for the Dynamic Analysis scan engine to be able to access all areas of the application.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_web_provide_login_creds
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: You can add your login credentials to a Dynamic Analysis for accessing the web application or API specification at the specified URLs.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: dynamic_web_selenium_best_practices
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Veracode provides recommendations for optimizing Selenium scripts you can use with Dynamic Analysis.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: README
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: A Veracode Dynamic Analysis scans your web applications or API specifications for vulnerabilities.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: video_dynamic_analysis_web_configure_ism
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to configure your Veracode Dynamic Analysis for internal scanning.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: video_dynamic_web_configure_login
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Watch the following video to learn about the different types of authentication that Veracode Dynamic Analysis can require to log in to your application and how to configure your Dynamic Analysis so that Veracode can log in.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.title: video_dynamic_web_create_scripts_selenium
dynamic_analysis/configuring_dast_web_sc.description: Watch the following video to learn how to use the Selenium IDE plugin to create a login sequence script that enables Veracode Dynamic Analysis to scan URLs that have form-based authentication.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/c.title: create_da_waf_imperva
dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/c.description: You can create web application firewalls \(WAF\) rules using Imperva. You can use these rules to block potential attacks based on the results of your dynamic scans.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/c.title: create_da_waf_modsec
dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/c.description: You can create web application firewalls \(WAF\) rules using ModSecurity. You can use these rules to block potential attacks based on the results of your dynamic scans.

dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/R.title: README
dynamic_analysis/configuring_waf_rules/R.description: Veracode works with you to build custom rules for web application firewalls \(WAF\). You can use these rules to block potential attacks based on the results of your dynamic scans.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/about.title: about_da_production_safe
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/about.description: The Veracode Dynamic Analysis scan engine is designed to test production web applications or API specifications with minimal impact. It uses testing approaches that do not harm or accidentally delete any data on the target website or API server. For example, the Veracode SQL injection test patterns use timing-based methods that append to the existing query without altering its logic. In addition, the XSS test strings inject JavaScript that is benign and does not execute outside the embedded browser used by the Dynamic Analysis scan engine.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/acces.title: access_da_in_platform
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/acces.description: From the Scans & Analysis menu, select Dynamic Analysis to open the Dynamic Analysis page.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/confi.title: configure_da_ism_scan_web
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/confi.description: You can configure a Dynamic Analysis with Veracode Internal Scanning Management \(ISM\) to scan web applications hosted within a corporate firewall and inaccessible to the public internet.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/creat.title: create_da_scan_web
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/creat.description: You can create a Dynamic Analysis in the Veracode Platform for scanning a web application or API specification.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/da_wo.title: da_workflow
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/da_wo.description: The Dynamic Analysis workflow for scanning web applications or API specifications consists of steps to configure the scan, run the scan, and view the results.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/delet.title: delete_da
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/delet.description: You can delete a Dynamic Analysis if no instances of the Dynamic Analysis are running. You must have the Creator or Security Lead role to be able to delete a Dynamic Analysis.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/prepa.title: preparing_da
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/prepa.description: Before starting a Veracode Dynamic Analysis, you must meet these prerequisites:

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/READM.title: README
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/READM.description: Veracode Dynamic Analysis is a Dynamic Application Security Testing \(DAST\) solution that delivers an automated and scalable dynamic scanning capability that enables broad coverage at speed. You can scan web applications or API specifications.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/run_a.title: run_authenticated_da_scan_web
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/run_a.description: You can use the basic steps in this use case to perform an authenticated Dynamic Analysis of a single URL. When running an authenticated analysis, you provide login credentials for access to the target URLs.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/run_u.title: run_unauthenticated_da_scan_web
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/run_u.description: You can use the basic steps in this use case to perform a simple, unauthenticated Dynamic Analysis of multiple URLs. When running an unauthenticated analysis, you do not provide login credentials for access to the target URLs.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/suppo.title: supported_da_tech
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/suppo.description: This list of technologies helps you understand what Dynamic Analysis supports before you try to perform an analysis.

dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/video.title: video_run_unauthenticated_da_scan_web
dynamic_analysis/getstarted_da_web/video.description: Watch the following video to learn how to create, configure, and schedule an unauthenticated Dynamic Analysis.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/REA.title: README
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/REA.description: You can prescan all URLs in a Dynamic Analysis to verify that Veracode can reach and, if necessary, authenticate with each target web application URL or API endpoint.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/rev.title: reviewing_da_prescan_errors
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/rev.description: You can review any prescan errors for a Dynamic Analysis in the Veracode Platform. All prescan errors relate to connection, auto-login, basic authentication, or login script issues.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/tro.title: troubleshoot_da_prescan_errors
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/tro.description: Prescan errors comprise two types: connection errors and authentication errors.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.title: video_initiate_da_prescan
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.description: Watch the following video to learn how to submit a Dynamic Analysis for prescan, what the Dynamic Analysis is testing during prescan, and how to tell if your Dynamic Analysis has passed prescan successfully.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.title: video_troubleshoot_da_prescan_errors_connect
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to address common connection errors that have resulted in an unsuccessful prescan as well as how to troubleshoot and resubmit the prescan.

dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.title: video_troubleshoot_prescan_errors_authenticate
dynamic_analysis/prescan_da_web_urls/vid.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to address common authentication errors that have resulted in an unsuccessful prescan as well as how to troubleshoot and resubmit the prescan.

dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/c.title: check_status_scheduled_dynamic_analysis
dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/c.description: After you submit the Dynamic Analysis, the summary of the schedule displays at the top of the summary of the Dynamic Analysis. You receive an email notification of any verification errors and also when the Dynamic Analysis is complete.

dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/R.title: README
dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/R.description: When configuring a Dynamic Analysis you can select to run it only one time, immediately after you submit it. You can also schedule the scan to run on a specific date or to run on a recurring schedule.

dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.title: schedule_dynamic_analysis.
dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.description: You can configure a one-time schedule for running a Dynamic Analysis web application scan or API specification scan.

dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.title: schedule_recurring_dynamic_analysis
dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.description: You can configure a recurring schedule of your Dynamic Analysis in the Veracode Platform to run on a set day and time each week or month. You can also schedule the analysis to automatically pause and resume at specific times, such as IT downtimes or high-traffic timeframes.

dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.title: stop_scheduled_dynamic_analysis
dynamic_analysis/scheduling_dast_scans/s.description: You can stop a Dynamic Analysis that runs on a schedule. When stopping the scan, you can choose to save or delete the available scan results.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: about_dynamic_app_linking
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: The Dynamic Analysis application linking feature allows you to link scan results to an application profile in the Veracode Platform.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: about_dynamic_url_scan_results
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can review Dynamic Analysis scan results for web application URLs in the Veracode Platform.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: autolink_da_to_apps
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: The Dynamic Analysis auto-linking feature automatically links URL scans from Dynamic Analyses to applications that already exist in the Veracode Platform. The matching process searches for URLs previously associated with the existing application that match the target URL in the Dynamic Analysis.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: manually_link_dynamic_analysis_to_app
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can link results from a Dynamic Analysis to an application profile to evaluate the results against policy. You can also see the results for all types of scans of the application aggregated in a single report.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: manually_unlink_da_results
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can unlink results when you no longer want to associate them with a specific application or to link them to a different application. You can perform this in the Veracode Platform or with the REST APIs.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: README
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can view the results for a Dynamic Analysis in the Triage Flaws view of the Veracode Platform.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: understand_da_coverage_report
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can see a simplified view of attack and non-attack traffic that Dynamic Analysis detects in the Dynamic Analysis Coverage Report. Dynamic Analysis generates the Coverage Report after a URL scan is complete and results are available.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: video_manually_link_unlink_da_app
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: Watch the following short video to learn how to manually link to and unlink from Dynamic Analysis results to an application.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: video_view_dynamic_web_results
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: Watch the following video to learn how to view Dynamic Analysis results.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: view_da_history
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can view detailed information about all occurrences of a Dynamic Analysis, including scan results, in the Veracode Platform.

dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.title: view_download_da_coverage_rpt
dynamic_analysis/viewing_dynamic_results.description: You can access the Dynamic Analysis Coverage Report from the Veracode Platform. The report provides details about the attack and non-attack traffic that Dynamic Analysis detected during scanning.

eLearning/elearning_master.title: elearning_master
eLearning/elearning_master.description: Veracode eLearning consists of course-based training that helps developers gain the critical skills they need to identify and address potential vulnerabilities.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_abou.title: c_about_auto_extend
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_abou.description: The auto-extend functionality allows you to automatically extend the subscription of an existing learner seat.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_assi.title: c_assigning_course_tracks
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_assi.description: Veracode provides course tracks to which you can assign learners.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_defi.title: c_defining_course_availability
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/c_defi.description: You choose courses from a curriculum to make available to learners.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/elearn.title: elearning_acl
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/elearn.description: Veracode eLearning administrators can view eLearning subscriptions and manage learners, eLearning managers, and course curricula.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/elearn.title: elearning_admin_page
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/elearn.description: To access the eLearning page, click the gear icon  in the upper-right corner of the Veracode Platform page, then select Admin. Select the eLearning tab. The eLearning page opens, showing the global settings.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: README
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: As a Veracode eLearning administrator, you can create curricula for learners.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_assign_curriculum
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: After creating an eLearning curriculum, you can assign one or more learners to the curriculum so that they can begin taking eLearning courses.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_elearning_fixed_date
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: You can create a new eLearning curriculum that includes a date when learners must complete the courses.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_elearning_fixed_date_compliance
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: You can create a new curriculum with a compliance reset date that requires learners to retake courses on a regular cadence.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_elearning_no_due_date
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: You can create a new curriculum without specifying a due date for learners to complete the courses.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_elearning_relative_date
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: You can create a new curriculum specifying a relative due date for learners to complete the courses.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.title: t_modify_curriculum
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/managi.description: You can modify the values of a curriculum, including the due date, compliance reset period, and whether courses are required.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_assi.title: t_assign_track_bulk
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_assi.description: You can manage course access and manager assignments for groups of eLearning learners.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_enab.title: t_enable_levels
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_enab.description: You can enable learner levels so that learners can prove their knowledge of secure software development practices.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_mana.title: t_manage_elearning_managers
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_mana.description: You can add an eLearning manager and assign learners to that manager.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_modi.title: t_modify_elearning_managers
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_modi.description: You can modify the eLearning manager assignment for learners.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_modi.title: t_modify_learner_settings
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_modi.description: You can configure settings for individual learners, including course track and curriculum assignments, auto-extend status, and assigned manager.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_noti.title: t_notification_settings
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_noti.description: You can manage which email notifications to send to eLearning learners and managers.

eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_view.title: t_view_elearning_license
eLearning/elearningAdministrators/t_view.description: You can view a summary of eLearning seat usage, including a count of total eLearning seats purchased and assigned, and of all used eLearning seats.

eLearning/elearningManagers/about_metric.title: README
eLearning/elearningManagers/about_metric.description: You can measure the success of an eLearning program by reviewing learner performance on courses.

eLearning/elearningManagers/about_metric.title: t_download_courses_report
eLearning/elearningManagers/about_metric.description: You can generate a report for the course progress of your learners.

eLearning/elearningManagers/c_elearn_man.title: c_elearn_manager_learning_level_progress
eLearning/elearningManagers/c_elearn_man.description: You can view the progress of your learners as they take eLearning courses.

eLearning/elearningManagers/c_send_email.title: c_send_email
eLearning/elearningManagers/c_send_email.description: On the All Courses tab, you can contact eLearning team members to prompt them to finish an incomplete course, retake a failed course, or congratulate them for passing a course. To email team members, click the envelope icon in the Action column. An email message is displayed, populated with a recipients list and email text. You can choose to send the email to the users who have passed, failed, or did not complete the course. You can edit the recipients, subject line, and body of the email as needed. Click Send.

eLearning/elearningManagers/elearning_ma.title: elearning_manager
eLearning/elearningManagers/elearning_ma.description: You can track the progress of your learners who are taking eLearning courses. If you have the Executive and eLearning roles, you can track the progress of all learners in your organization.

eLearning/elearningManagers/t_view_curri.title: t_view_curricula_learner_level_progress
eLearning/elearningManagers/t_view_curri.description: You can view curricula and learner level progress for learners you manage.

eLearning/elearningUsers/c_about_appsec_.title: c_about_appsec_tutorials
eLearning/elearningUsers/c_about_appsec_.description: Veracode AppSec Tutorials provide quick learning sessions on common software vulnerabilities. In under ten minutes, you can gain an understanding of a specific vulnerability, including how it can be exploited, examples of vulnerable code, and guidance on how to fix the vulnerability. When you do not have time to take an entire Veracode eLearning course, you can view an AppSec Tutorial to learn about application security best practices.

eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_about.title: elearning_aboutkb
eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_about.description: The Veracode eLearning Knowledge Base is a centralized collection of information about security vulnerabilities, and techniques you can use to prevent vulnerabilities. You can also view the CWE information for each flaw category and suggested Veracode eLearning courses you can take to learn more about security practices. On the Veracode eLearning Knowledge Base, you can view flaw category information on topics including:

eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_rec_c.title: elearning_rec_courses
eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_rec_c.description: Veracode recommends eLearning courses to learners based on the results of their scans.

eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_wbcou.title: elearning_wbcourselist
eLearning/elearningUsers/elearning_wbcou.description: If you are a learner, you can view your progress in eLearning training.

eLearning/elearningUsers/understanding_l.title: README
eLearning/elearningUsers/understanding_l.description: As you complete assigned courses, you achieve the Veracode learner levels.

eLearning/elearningUsers/understanding_l.title: t_complete_learner_level
eLearning/elearningUsers/understanding_l.description: You can view your learner levels and download a certificate that shows your completion of the Veracode eLearning courses.

grc/archer_xml_apis_quickref.title: archer_xml_apis_quickref
grc/archer_xml_apis_quickref.description: This table lists the XML API calls for getting Archer reports, which you can use for Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC). For more detailed information, see the topic for a specific call.

grc/c_about_archer.title: c_about_archer
grc/c_about_archer.description: The Archer dashboard is a platform for Governance, Risk, and Compliance \(GRC\) solutions. The Archer dashboard consumes XML data feeds to integrate data from a variety of sources into a unified view of enterprise-wide risk.

grc/c_about_grc.title: c_about_grc
grc/c_about_grc.description: Veracode supports Governance, Risk, and Compliance \(GRC\) with an Archer integration.

grc/c_archer_xml.title: c_archer_xml
grc/c_archer_xml.description: This table describes the fields in the Archer XML report.

grc/r_archer_deprec.title: r_archer_deprec
grc/r_archer_deprec.description: Veracode has deprecated the archer.do call. Although this call is functional, Veracode recommends that you use the asynchronous Archer API calls to avoid lengthy wait times and timeouts when retrieving large data sets.

grc/r_downloadarcher.title: r_downloadarcher
grc/r_downloadarcher.description: The downloadarcherreport.do call returns the Archer XML report generated by the generatearcherreport.do call.

grc/r_generatearcher.title: r_generatearcher
grc/r_generatearcher.description: The generatearcherreport.do call initiates the process of generating the Archer report, which contains a token you use to retrieve the report when the processing is complete.

greenlight/about_greenlight.title: about_greenlight

greenlight/greenlight_best_practices.title: greenlight_best_practices
greenlight/greenlight_best_practices.description: Veracode Greenlight detects coding best practices in which the code has protected the application against specific Common Weakness Enumerations (CWEs).

For example, the build.gradle file must contain apply plugin: 'java'.

If you are compiling with Maven or Gradle, Veracode recommends that you use the Eclipse plugin for that build tool to import your files.

greenlight/greenlight_visual_studio/revi.title: greenlight_visual_studio_filter_results

The green text indicates code that complies with best practices and is protected against specific CWEs.

Where applicable for specific CWE findings, you can also access the Veracode AppSec tutorials to learn more.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: Watch this video to learn how to download, import, and view Veracode scan results using Veracode Static for IntelliJ. You can also learn how to mitigate discovered flaws from within IntelliJ.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: view_call_stacks_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can view call stacks for findings in from within your IDE.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: view_flaw_details_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can view detailed information of Veracode scan results in the Flaw Details view from within your IDE.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: README
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: Veracode Static for IntelliJ is a plugin for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that enables you to upload binaries to Veracode for static analysis. You can work with the scan results from within your IDE to review and mitigate security findings in your applications.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: debug_prescan_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can debug prescan files if your uploaded files are in error status.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: README
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can upload binaries of your applications in the Veracode Static Plugin for your IDE.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: run_prescan_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can begin a prescan of your application binaries immediately after you upload all files to Veracode. Prescans send email notifications when they complete. You can also check for prescan results using the getprescanresults.do call.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: upload_files_sandbox_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: You can create a sandbox into which you upload your application files from your IDE. You can then scan your application from the sandbox.

ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.title: video_upload_files_static_intellij
ides/static_for_intellij_android_studio/.description: Watch this short video to learn how to use Veracode Static for IntelliJ to upload binaries of your applications for static analysis policy scans and sandbox scans.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/con.title: configure_precomp_static_vs_legacy

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/con.title: msbuild_paths_vs2015_legacy
ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/con.description: You can install Visual Studio 2015 and later in a custom path. You need to add the custom path to MSBuild, based on the listed path patterns. A custom path follows the same patterns shown here, starting after the \Program Files (x86) directory.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/con.title: msbuild_paths_vs2017_legacy

As appropriate, you can replace \Professional with \Enterprise or \Community. The Visual Studio Preview installation also changes the path based on Enterprise, Professional, or Community.

As appropriate, you can replace \Professional with \Enterprise or \Community. The Visual Studio Preview installation also changes the path based on Enterprise, Professional, or Community.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.description: You can download and import Veracode results from within your IDE using the Results API. You can download and import the results from the Veracode Platform.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.title: import_results_platform_static_vs_legacy
ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.description: You can download and import Veracode results from the Veracode Platform and view them in your IDE. You can also download and import results with the Results API.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.description: You can mitigate flaws, including approving and rejecting existing mitigations, from within your IDE.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.description: You can use Veracode Static for Visual Studio with the Results API to download and review scan results in Visual Studio. You can also download scan results from the Veracode Platform. Then, you can review and mitigate any discovered flaws from within Visual Studio.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.title: video_working_results_static_vs_legacy
ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/man.description: Watch this video to learn how to download, import, and view Veracode scan results using Veracode Static for Visual Studio. You can also learn how to mitigate findings discovered during the scan in Visual Studio.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/REA.description: Veracode Static for Visual Studio is an extension for Microsoft Visual Studio. You use the extension to assist with compiling your applications into binaries, uploading the binaries to Veracode for static analysis, and review scan results from within the IDE. You must upload any JavaScript code separately, as described in the compilation instructions.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/sca.description: You can create a development sandbox into which you upload your application files from your IDE. You can then scan your application from the sandbox.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/sca.title: README
ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/sca.description: After using Veracode Static for Visual Studio to create a Veracode build of your application, you can upload the build to a new or existing application profile in your Veracode portfolio.

ides/static_for_visual_studio_legacy/sca.description: Watch this video to learn how to prepare a build of your application using Veracode Static for Visual Studio and upload the build to a new or existing application profile in your Veracode portfolio.

integrations_troubleshootting/using_ssl_.description: After creating an SSL certificate you want to use with Veracode integrations, verify which Java Runtime Environment to use with the TrustStore.

integrations_troubleshootting/using_ssl_.title: README
integrations_troubleshootting/using_ssl_.description: SSL certificates allow secure connections from a web server to a browser, domain name, server name, or hostname. Many Veracode integrations use Java, which maintains its own TrustStore. The Java TrustStore may not have the SSL root certificate.

integrations_troubleshootting/using_ssl_.title: t_import_certificate

intro.title: Tutorial Intro
intro.description: Let's discover Docusaurus in less than 5 minutes.

ism/about_ism.title: about_ism
ism/about_ism.description: Veracode Internal Scanning Management \(ISM\) is a simplified approach to web application scanning for applications hosted within a corporate firewall that cannot be reached from the public internet. ISM allows Veracode to bring uniformity to the scanning of external and internal applications for Veracode Dynamic Analysis users.

ism/about_ism_gateway_retention.title: about_ism_gateway_retention
ism/about_ism_gateway_retention.description: Veracode automatically deletes an Internal Scanning Management gateway and its associated endpoints if it has no scan activity for four months.

ism/add_endpoint_to_gateway.title: add_endpoint_to_gateway
ism/add_endpoint_to_gateway.description: When you configure a gateway, you must create one endpoint that connects to it. After you configure the gateway, you can add more endpoints to it. Veracode recommends that you install one endpoint in each network in which you scan your internal applications.

ism/best_practices_endpoint_management.title: best_practices_endpoint_management
ism/best_practices_endpoint_management.description: Veracode recommends that you comply with these best practices for managing your endpoints to make the most effective use of Veracode Internal Scanning Management (ISM).

ism/best_practices_gateway_management.title: best_practices_gateway_management
ism/best_practices_gateway_management.description: Veracode recommends that you comply with these best practices for managing your gateway to make the most effective use of Veracode Internal Scanning Management (ISM).

ism/configure_internal_scanning.title: configure_internal_scanning
ism/configure_internal_scanning.description: Your Veracode Internal Scanning Management \(ISM\) configuration consists of a gateway that is the access point to the Veracode cloud and endpoints, which connect Veracode to your internal applications.

ism/configure_ism_endpoint_access.title: configure_ism_endpoint_access
ism/configure_ism_endpoint_access.description: You can make your endpoints accessible to Veracode for security scanning and to receive technical support. By default, scan access is enabled and Veracode support engineer access is disabled.

ism/delete_gateway.title: delete_gateway
ism/delete_gateway.description: If you created a gateway in error or have stopped using it, you can delete it from your ISM configuration.

ism/delete_ism_endpoint.title: delete_ism_endpoint
ism/delete_ism_endpoint.description: If you created an endpoint in error or have stopped using it, you can delete it from your ISM configuration.

ism/edit_ism_endpoint.title: edit_ism_endpoint
ism/edit_ism_endpoint.description: After you create an endpoint, you can edit the endpoint name and description.

ism/ism_endpoint_installer.title: ism_endpoint_installer
ism/ism_endpoint_installer.description: Veracode recommends you use the ISM endpoint installer to install endpoints on Windows or Linux servers instead of performing a manual installation.

ism/ism_endpoint_release_history.title: ism_endpoint_release_history
ism/ism_endpoint_release_history.description: View the list of changes included in the latest versions of the Veracode Internal Scanning Management endpoint.

ism/ism_notifications.title: ism_notifications
ism/ism_notifications.description: Veracode sends email notifications for significant events that affect your Veracode Internal Scanning Management \(ISM\) gateway or endpoints.

ism/manually_install_endpoint.title: manually_install_endpoint
ism/manually_install_endpoint.description: If you are running your endpoint on a machine other than Windows or Linux, or you choose not to use the ISM endpoint installer, you can manually install the endpoint.

ism/manually_update_endpoint.title: manually_update_endpoint
ism/manually_update_endpoint.description: If Veracode releases a new endpoint version, you can install the update of your endpoint JAR file from the command line.

ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/ism_dia.title: ism_diagnostic_parameters
ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/ism_dia.description: You can set your preferred parameters for the Veracode Internal Scanning Management (ISM) endpoint diagnostic tool in your application.properties file to avoid having to set them every time you run a test.

ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/ism_dia.title: ism_diagnostic_results
ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/ism_dia.description: The Veracode Internal Scanning Management (ISM) endpoint diagnostic tool provides details of the performance of the connections to your endpoint. It measures the connection from the endpoint to both the Veracode gateway and the application you want to scan.

ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/README.title: README
ism/test_ism_endpoint_diagnostic/README.description: You can use the Veracode Internal Scanning Management endpoint diagnostic tool to test both of the connections necessary to complete a Dynamic Analysis with ISM: the connection between the endpoint and the Veracode gateway and the connection between the endpoint and your application URL.

ism/troubleshooting_configuration_ism_en.title: troubleshooting_configuration_ism_endpoint_installer
ism/troubleshooting_configuration_ism_en.description: This table provides guidance for resolving errors you may encounter using the ISM endpoint installer. If an issue persists after attempting the solution, contact Veracode Technical Support.

ism/troubleshooting_ism.title: troubleshooting_ism
ism/troubleshooting_ism.description: This table provides guidance for resolving errors you may encounter when trying to perform a Veracode Dynamic Analysis with ISM. The error text appears in the ISM log files and, if you are running the endpoint from the command line, on the command prompt.

ism/uninstall_ism_endpoint.title: uninstall_ism_endpoint
ism/uninstall_ism_endpoint.description: If you installed an endpoint using the endpoint installer, but no longer want to use it for scanning, you can uninstall it from your machine.

ism/update_ism_endpoint.title: update_ism_endpoint
ism/update_ism_endpoint.description: If Veracode releases a new endpoint version or you want to update your endpoint proxy settings or Java home, you can install the update with the endpoint installer.

ism/video_install_endpoint_ism_installer.title: video_install_endpoint_ism_installer
ism/video_install_endpoint_ism_installer.description: Watch this short video to learn how to create a gateway in the Veracode Platform and install an endpoint in your network using the Veracode ISM endpoint installer for Windows. This process allows Veracode Dynamic Analysis to scan applications that are hosted behind your firewall.

ism/view_ism_endpoint_logs.title: view_ism_endpoint_logs
ism/view_ism_endpoint_logs.description: If you encounter errors using ISM, you can refer to the log files for your endpoint to help with troubleshooting.

Mobile/understanding_mobile/README.title: README
Mobile/understanding_mobile/README.description: Veracode Mobile Behavioral Analysis provides security related findings for mobile applications. Veracode examines the permissions that the submitted mobile application requests, which can provide valuable insights into the behavior of the application.

Mobile/understanding_mobile/using_mobile.title: using_mobile_analysis
Mobile/understanding_mobile/using_mobile.description: You can submit your application for Mobile Behavioral Analysis to view details about the permissions granted to the application, and then decide if the permissions are appropriate for your application.

MPT/devops_penetration_testing.title: devops_penetration_testing
MPT/devops_penetration_testing.description: In addition to performing manual testing for an application, Veracode DevOps Penetration Testing can evaluate the following areas:

MPT/focused_mpt.title: focused_mpt
MPT/focused_mpt.description: In some situations, timing restraints, budgetary considerations, or strategic planning purposes may require limiting the level of effort for penetration testing.

MPT/README.title: README
MPT/README.description: You can conduct a manual penetration assessment to observe the application in a runtime environment and simulate real-world attack scenarios. Penetration testing includes efforts to:

MPT/request_manual.title: request_manual
MPT/request_manual.description: To request Veracode Manual Penetration Testing, contact your Veracode account manager or Sales team.

packaging/net/asp_net_web_apps/t_package.description: You can use the native Microsoft Publish utility in Visual Studio 2019 to prepare binaries and publish them for a specific project. You can then upload the files to Veracode for scanning. This procedure is an alternative to using Veracode Static for Visual Studio.
