packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: annotate_net_code
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: You can add Veracode custom cleanser annotations to your .NET code to improve mitigations when using Veracode Static Analysis.

packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: README
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: You can annotate Veracode custom cleanser functions in your code to mitigate findings that the Veracode Static Analysis normally finds.

packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: README
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: To see the frameworks Veracode supports, click the languages in the Packaging Requirements table of contents to the left. Each page for the language you click has a table with supported frameworks and their versions.

packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: README
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: If you suspect that an attacker compromised data in your applications, you can use cleansing functions to resolve the modifications before the data reaches a potentially vulnerable location.

packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: supported_classic_asp_cleansing
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: Veracode recognizes several functions native to Classic ASP that provide adequate protection against injection-type attacks:

packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.title: supported_perl_cleansing
packaging/supported_framworks_cleansers/.description: Veracode recognizes these cleansing functions for CWE-80 in Perl CGI applications:

packaging/titan.title: titan
packaging/titan.description: Your Titanium applications must meet specific compilation requirements before you can submit them for scanning.

packaging/understanding_packaging/c_comp.title: c_comp_quickref
packaging/understanding_packaging/c_comp.description: Veracode provides compilation and packaging recommendations for popular languages and frameworks.

packaging/understanding_packaging/initia.title: initial_full_support
packaging/understanding_packaging/initia.description: You can see the phrases "Initial support" and "Supported" throughout this Veracode Packaging Requirements publication. They refer to two different development phases at which Veracode releases scan support for a language or framework.

packaging/understanding_packaging/README.title: README
packaging/understanding_packaging/README.description: Veracode provides specific packaging recommendations for ensuring successful scans.

packaging/vb6.title: vb6
packaging/vb6.description: Your Visual Basic 6 applications must meet specific compilation requirements before you can submit them for scanning.

packaging/winccpp.title: winccpp
packaging/winccpp.description: Your C/C++ applications must meet specific compilation requirements before you can submit them for scanning.

packaging/xamarin.title: xamarin
packaging/xamarin.description: Your Xamarin applications must meet specific compilation requirements before you can submit them for scanning.

pipeline_scan/c_pipeline_scan_config_sce.title: c_pipeline_scan_config_scenarios
pipeline_scan/c_pipeline_scan_config_sce.description: This section provides a few configuration scenarios that you can use when deciding how you want to implement a Pipeline Scan in your development environment. You add these scenarios to a stage in your pipeline that runs after the stage for building your application.

pipeline_scan/c_pipeline_scan_logging.title: c_pipeline_scan_logging
pipeline_scan/c_pipeline_scan_logging.description: Veracode provides a few configuration options for generating log messages from Pipeline Scans.

pipeline_scan/c_using_policies_with_pipe.title: c_using_policies_with_pipeline_scan
pipeline_scan/c_using_policies_with_pipe.description: You can use a Veracode security policy to evaluate the scan results from a Pipeline Scan.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.title: c_about_pipeline_baseline_file
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.description: The Pipeline Scan provides the ability to set a baseline of known security findings. It stores these findings in a JSON file called the baseline or baseline file. The Pipeline Scan can compare discovered findings against the baseline file to identify new findings.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.title: c_pipeline_scan_prereqs
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.description: Your environment must meet specific prerequisites before you can successfully upload your packaged application to Veracode and run Pipeline Scans.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.title: c_video_run_a_pipeline_scan
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/c.description: Watch the following video to learn how a Pipeline Scan runs directly within a CI/CD environment. This demo takes place in a GitLab CI/CD environment where the scan is already configured. You can customize a Pipeline Scan for your unique development workflow.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/R.title: README
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/R.description: You can use Pipeline Scans to evaluate the security of your application within a development pipeline.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.title: t_download_pipeline_scan
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.description: You can obtain the latest version of the Pipeline Scan as a ZIP archive from Veracode or as a container image from Docker Hub.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.title: t_run_first_pipeline_scans_desktop
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.description: You can run a few Pipeline Scan commands at a local console, outside of a development pipeline, to get started with running a scan and viewing scan results without the need for a test or production pipeline. You can also use the command line for debugging.

pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.title: t_run_pipeline_scan
pipeline_scan/getstarted_pipeline_scan/t.description: You can add the Pipeline Scan to a job in your development pipeline. You can use the provided code examples as templates for adding the Pipeline Scan as a stage in a pipeline job and configure the command parameters to achieve the desired scan results.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.title: r_azure_baseline_file_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.description: This YAML code example shows how to generate and use a baseline file in an Azure DevOps build pipeline.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.title: r_azure_pipeline_yaml_example_dotnet
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in an Azure DevOps build pipeline for an ASP.NET application on Windows.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.title: r_azure_scan_maven_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in an Azure DevOps build pipeline that uses Maven on Unix.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.title: r_azure_scan_yaml_pipeline_gradle_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in an Azure DevOps build pipeline that uses Gradle.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.title: README
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_azure_exampl.description: You can add a Pipeline Scan as a job in an Azure DevOps pipeline. You can use the YAML code examples in this section to configure Azure DevOps pipelines for building a project and running the Pipeline Scan as a stage in the pipeline.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.title: r_github_baseline_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.description: This YAML code example shows how to generate and use a baseline file in a GitHub Actions workflow.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.title: r_github_gradle_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a GitHub Actions build pipeline that uses Gradle.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.title: r_github_maven_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a GitHub Actions build pipeline with Maven.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.title: README
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_github_examp.description: You can add a Pipeline Scan as a step in a GitHub Actions workflow. You can use the YAML code examples this section to configure GitHub Action workflows for building a project and running the Pipeline Scan as a step in the workflow.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_gradle
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a GitLab Actions build pipeline using Gradle.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_gradle_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan and automatic issue generation as a build stage in a GitLab build pipeline using Gradle.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_gradle_vulnerability_custom_policy
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: These code examples show how to download a custom policy and use it in a GitLab pipeline with Gradle and automatic vulnerability generation.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_gradle_vulnerability_example
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan and automatic vulnerability generation as a build stage in a GitLab build pipeline using Gradle. Automatic vulnerability generation requires a GitLab Premium or Ultimate license.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_maven
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This example YAML code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a GitLab Actions build pipeline using Maven.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_pipeline_scan_baseline
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This YAML code example shows how to generate, store, and use a baseline file in a GitLab build pipeline.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: r_gitlab_vulnerability_gen_built_in
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: This YAML code example shows how to add a Pipeline Scan to GitLab with Gradle using a built-in policy and automatic vulnerability generation.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: README
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: You can add a Pipeline Scan as a job in a GitLab pipeline. You can use the YAML code examples in this section to configure GitLab pipeline jobs for building a project and running a Pipeline Scan as a stage in the pipeline.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: t_set_access_token_gitlab
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: You can create a GitLab access token and set it as an environment variable to enable a Pipeline Scan to generate GitLab issues from discovered flaws.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.title: t_set_gitlab_environment_variables
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_gitlab_examp.description: You can set environment variables for GitLab base directories to enable a Pipeline Scan to generate GitLab issues of discovered flaws when scanning Java applications.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.title: r_jenkins_baseline
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.description: This example Groovy code shows how you can add a Pipeline Scan that uses a baseline file to a Jenkins build pipeline.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.title: r_jenkins_gradle
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.description: This example Groovy code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a Jenkins build pipeline that uses Gradle.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.title: r_jenkins_maven
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.description: This example Groovy code shows how to add a Pipeline Scan as a build stage in a Jenkins build pipeline that uses Maven.

pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.title: README
pipeline_scan/pipeline_scan_jenkins_exam.description: You can add a Pipeline Scan as a job in a Jenkins declarative pipeline. You configure a Jenkins pipeline with a Jenkins file that defines stages of running the pipeline. You can use the Groovy code examples in this section to configure a Jenkins build job for building a project and running a Pipeline Scan as a stage in the pipeline.

pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_commands.title: r_pipeline_scan_commands
pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_commands.description: You use command-line parameters to configure the Pipeline Scan settings.

pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_examples.title: r_pipeline_scan_examples
pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_examples.description: Veracode provides code examples that you can add as a stage in a development pipeline job for running a Pipeline Scan. You add the Pipeline Scan stage after the stage that builds your application.

pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_output.title: r_pipeline_scan_output
pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_output.description: This section provides example scan results from Pipeline Scans.

pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_status_cod.title: r_pipeline_scan_status_codes
pipeline_scan/r_pipeline_scan_status_cod.description: This table describes the status codes for a completed Pipeline Scan. You can configure your development pipeline to use these status codes for pass-fail criteria during scanning.

policies/blocklist.title: blocklist
policies/blocklist.description: You can create a list of third-party software components that are known to contain unacceptable security vulnerabilities. Components on the blocklist are third-party software code that the organization prohibits.

policies/copy.title: copy
policies/copy.description: If you want to create a new policy that is similar to an existing policy, you can copy that policy and make the changes you want. Copying a policy can simplify the process of creating a new policy.

policies/create_policy/README.title: README
policies/create_policy/README.description: Policies must include one or more of the following types of requirements to which an application must adhere: rules, evaluation timeframes, scan requirements, and remediation grace periods. You define the requirements while creating a new policy.

policies/create_policy/video_create_poli.title: video_create_policy
policies/create_policy/video_create_poli.description: Watch the following video to learn how to create a custom policy in the Veracode Platform.

policies/delete.title: delete
policies/delete.description: You can delete any custom policy.

policies/edit.title: edit
policies/edit.description: You can edit a custom policy at any time. If you edit a policy that is assigned to any applications, Veracode automatically re-evaluates the applications against the updated policy.

policies/enforcing_sec.title: enforcing_sec
policies/enforcing_sec.description: You can use Veracode to enforce consistent application security policies across your entire inventory of applications, both those that you develop and third-party applications. You can use a pre-defined Veracode policy or create your own custom policy to enforce the rules of your organization.

policies/grace_period/policy_sca_grace_p.title: policy_sca_grace_periods
policies/grace_period/policy_sca_grace_p.description: You can set distinct grace periods for each of your Veracode Software Composition Analysis policy rules in the same policy in which you define grace periods for other scan types. You can also set grace periods for specific CVSS score ranges.

policies/grace_period/README.title: README
policies/grace_period/README.description: When creating policies, you can define remediation grace periods for Minimum Scan Score, Component Blocklist Enforcement, Component Licenses, and Vulnerability CVSS Score rules. You can also specify grace periods by severity that apply to Findings by Severity, Security Standard, Findings by CWE ID, and Findings in CWE Category rules.

policies/notifications.title: notifications
policies/notifications.description: The Veracode Platform can send notifications automatically when specific policy-related events occur. Whether you receive policy notifications depends on your notification settings.

policies/policy_app.title: policy_app
policies/policy_app.description: When you set the business criticality for the application, the Veracode Platform automatically assigns a policy to an application, based on the default policy rules of the organization. If you have the Policy Administrator role, you can override the default policy on an application in the application profile.

policies/policy_control_report.title: policy_control_report
policies/policy_control_report.description: After scanning an application, part of the extensive report information you receive includes a summary of how well the application adhered to the policies assigned to it. The Policy Control tab on the View Report page lists the names and descriptions of the assigned policies and provides the details of how the application met the requirements of the:

policies/policy_custom_severities.title: policy_custom_severities
policies/policy_custom_severities.description: When creating a policy, you can customize the severity levels by giving them a higher or lower severity than the Veracode standard. Custom severities apply immediately, changing the results of the latest scan for all applications assigned to this policy.

policies/policy_eval_time.title: policy_eval_time
policies/policy_eval_time.description: When creating a policy, you can define the dates on which findings can impact the policy compliance of your applications. Findings that are opened or reopened during the evaluation timeframe can cause an application to not pass policy.

policies/policy_rules.title: policy_rules
policies/policy_rules.description: When creating a policy, you can add several rules that applications must follow to pass the policy.

policies/policy_scan_reqs.title: policy_scan_reqs
policies/policy_scan_reqs.description: When creating a policy, you can set a single scan frequency requirement for all scan types or set the requirement for specific scan types.

policies/README.title: README
policies/README.description: You can define and enforce a uniform application security policy across all applications in a portfolio for your organization.

policies/sca_policy.title: sca_policy
policies/sca_policy.description: Click here to read how to restrict an application from using vulnerable third-party components by adding Veracode Software Composition Analysis requirements to your policy.

policies/setdefaults.title: setdefaults
policies/setdefaults.description: You can set default policies that Veracode automatically assigns to newly created applications.

policies/understand.title: understand
policies/understand.description: The Veracode Platform enables an organization to define and enforce a uniform application security policy across all applications in its portfolio. An application security policy includes these elements:

policies/veracodedefault.title: veracodedefault
policies/veracodedefault.description: Veracode provides default policies to make it easier for organizations to begin measuring their applications against policies. There are these two sets of default policies:

policies/veracodelevel.title: veracodelevel
policies/veracodelevel.description: Veracode determines the Veracode Level \(VL\) of an application by the type of testing it performs on the application and the severity and types of flaws it detects. A minimum security score is required for each level.

release_notes/euregion/README.title: README
release_notes/euregion/README.description: Release notes for the European Region describe the new Veracode features and updates available to organizations that have their Veracode account data hosted in Europe. The new features available to the other organizations are described in the United States Region Release Notes.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_apps.title: past_appsec_platform
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_apps.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_dyna.title: past_dynamic
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_dyna.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_inte.title: past_integrations
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_inte.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_SCA.title: past_SCA
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_SCA.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_stat.title: past_static
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_stat.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_trai.title: past_training
release_notes/usregion/08_2021/past_trai.description: View the list below for highlights of previous releases.

release_notes/usregion/09_2020/01_2020_r.title: 01_2020_rns
release_notes/usregion/09_2020/01_2020_r.description: View the list below for highlights of releases in 2020.

release_notes/usregion/README.title: README
release_notes/usregion/README.description: Release notes for the United States Region describe the new Veracode features and updates available to organizations that use the United States domains. The new features available to organizations that have their Veracode account data hosted in Europe are described in the European Region Release Notes.

release_notes/usregion/usregion_intro.title: usregion_intro
release_notes/usregion/usregion_intro.description: Select the Release Notes for a Veracode product or scan type:

results_reports/about_summarized_results.title: about_summarized_results
results_reports/about_summarized_results.description: The Summarized Results section of the Results page provides an overview of all the flaws by severity and status, as well as a summary of the top risks and how your metrics data is trending.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: download_customizable_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: You can customize the PDF document of the application security findings in your latest policy scan to include only the contents that you need.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: download_detailed_veracode_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: You can generate a report of your application security findings to share vulnerability statistics of applications and websites with your stakeholders.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: download_pci_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: Some applications may be subject to Payment Card Industry (PCI) criteria such as PCI-DSS and PA-DSS. Veracode provides the ability to evaluate any application against the PCI standards via the PCI report.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: download_summary_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: You can download a Summary Report to share summary information about the security quality of your application without sharing the details of the discovered findings.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: README
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: From the Results page, you can view the Veracode and PCI Compliance reports to gain insights into your application security program activity and a better understanding of the business risk of vulnerabilities in your application. In addition, you can download reports, bookmark reports, share results, and schedule a consultation.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: reviewing_assessment_summary
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: The assessment summary report shows how many modules were included in the Static Analysis, how many call sites were in the modules, and how many of those call sites are vulnerable.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: share_reports_from_platform
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: Vendors who want to share scan results can generate reports for enterprise organizations. To enable the sharing of Veracode reports, contact Veracode Technical Support.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: summarized_results
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: The Summarized Results section of the Results page in the Veracode Platform provides an excellent overview of all the flaws by severity and status, as well as a summary of the top risks and how your metrics data is trending.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: understanding_customizable_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: The Customizable Report summarizes the security findings identified during the most recent policy scan, the application policy status, and recommendations to fix the findings.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: README
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: Veracode exports, in XML format, detailed information about an application, including some application profile data, information about scans performed, Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\) data if available, and a list of open and fixed flaws. You can download this information from the Results page. The format for the download is the same as that provided by the Results API.

results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.title: understanding_data_in__XML_report
results_reports/accessing_veracode_repor.description: The XML export contains some data that is provided for automated consumption of flaw results, including remediation status and date first found.

results_reports/improve/developing_remed.title: developing_remediation_plan
results_reports/improve/developing_remed.description: After you review the flaws identified in a Veracode automated scan, you can use the guidance in the Triage Flaws page and the report to fix the flaws.

results_reports/improve/generate_link_to.title: generate_link_to_latest_instance_of_flaw
results_reports/improve/generate_link_to.description: You can provide a URL directly to the latest instance of a flaw to save your team the time of navigating through the Veracode Platform to find it.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: accept_reject_mitigations_mitigated_flaws
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: You can accept or reject proposed mitigations in the Mitigated Flaws page for both internally developed and third-party applications.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: accept_reject_mitigations_triage
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: A user with the Mitigation Approver role can accept or reject proposed mitigations from the Triage Flaws page of your application. To see a list of proposed mitigations, in the Search field, select Mitigation and = Mitigation Proposed. To view all mitigations except the type you selected, click the equals icon again.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: accepting_rejecting_mitigations
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: To accept or reject a proposed mitigation, you must have the Mitigation Approver role. To remove mitigations from the policy evaluation and security score calculation, you must accept all proposed mitigations.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: comment_on_flaws
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: When you comment on a flaw, other team members can review the comment to share your opinions and offer possible remediation methods, work assignments, and other shared ideas. User comments are not exported on the scan reports. Therefore, you can consider the comments as a private type of working area while you and your team remediate flaws.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: managing_mitigations_several_flaws
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: You can make changes to multiple selected flaws at the same time, including commenting, marking as mitigated, or approving or rejecting mitigations if you have the appropriate role permissions. The multiple change performs the selected action on all flaws that you currently have checked out.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: perform_multiple_changes_triage
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: You can change more than one flaw at once from the Triage Flaws page.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: perform_multiples_changes_mitigated_flaws
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: You can accept, reject, or comment on several flaws from the Mitigated Flaws Page.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: README
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: After Veracode completes a scan of your code, you can apply mitigation actions on any discovered vulnerabilities.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: reviewing_flaws_as_team
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: After a scan completes, members of the application security and development teams can review the list of flaws and:

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: reviewing_user_feedback_on_flaw
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: You can see comments, mitigation descriptions, and potential false positive reports made by other team members for each flaw. All actions display the ID of the user who left the feedback and the date and time the user performed the action.

results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.title: view_mitigated_flaws_reports
results_reports/improve/improve_mitigati.description: After you have approved one or more mitigated flaws, the reports for the application update to show information about the mitigations as follows:

results_reports/improve/matching_flaws_b.title: matching_flaws_between_scans
results_reports/improve/matching_flaws_b.description: Carrying mitigations and comments forward from one scan to the next requires that the flaws match from one scan to the next of the same application.

results_reports/improve/README.title: README
results_reports/improve/README.description: After you have the report for your application, you can improve its security quality using the Veracode Platform:

results_reports/improve/review_third_par.title: review_third_party_app_vendor
results_reports/improve/review_third_par.description: In a third-party application scan request, a Veracode customer \(enterprise\) requests summary results of an application scan from another party \(the vendor\). The vendor receives the detailed results from Veracode, and may propose and approve mitigations for any flaws in the report at any time. If the enterprise has already received the summary results, their report is automatically updated with new approved mitigations.

results_reports/improve/schedule_consult.title: schedule_consultation
results_reports/improve/schedule_consult.description: Consultation calls provide you the opportunity to get assistance with configuring and running a scan or with interpreting the findings in your application. During scan configuration calls, Veracode can answer specific questions you have about your scan configuration or walk you through the best practices for setting up your scan. During scan results calls, Veracode can help you understand the significance of the findings and provide guidance on remediation and mitigation.

results_reports/improve/schedule_next_da.title: schedule_next_day_consultation
results_reports/improve/schedule_next_da.description: You can schedule a consultation for the following day if you have a next-day consultation subscription. A consultation call with Veracode can help answer specific questions you have about your scan results, help you understand the significance of the findings, and provide guidance on remediation and mitigations.

results_reports/improve/searching_for_sp.title: searching_for_specific_flaw
results_reports/improve/searching_for_sp.description: The Triage Flaws view in the Veracode Platform shows detailed information on each flaw detected during Veracode analyses of your application. You can search for flaws using one or several criteria, including negative criteria and wildcards.

results_reports/improve/understanding_ve.title: understanding_veracode_mprs
results_reports/improve/understanding_ve.description: You can purchase an optional Veracode Mitigation Proposal Review \(MPR\) service from Veracode to request that Veracode consultants perform additional mitigation triage work for your applications.

results_reports/improve/verifying_your_f.title: verifying_your_fixes
results_reports/improve/verifying_your_f.description: After fixing flaws in your application that Veracode identified, you should scan your application again. A subsequent scan is necessary to verify that the fixes were effective and that additional security flaws were not introduced by the fixes. The first step in verifying your fixes is to submit a new scan of your application. Once the scan is complete, a number of features are provided in the Veracode Platform and in the application report.

results_reports/improve/working_collabor.title: working_collaboratively_in_triage_flaws
results_reports/improve/working_collabor.description: The Triage Flaws page enables a team of developers and security reviewers to work with the flaws that Veracode reports.

results_reports/review_methodology/best_.title: best_practice_findings
results_reports/review_methodology/best_.description: Veracode static scans can detect and report certain uses of security best practices, including correct use of security features and correct defensive measures against injection attacks. Information about best practice use appears in the Best Practice Findings section of the Veracode on-screen and Detailed Report PDF.

results_reports/review_methodology/busin.title: business_criticality
results_reports/review_methodology/busin.description: The foundation of the Veracode rating system is the concept that more critical applications require higher security quality scores to be acceptable risks. Less business critical applications can tolerate lower security quality. The business criticality is dictated by the typical deployed environment and the value of data used by the application. Factors that determine business criticality are: reputation damage, financial loss, operational risk, sensitive information disclosure, personal safety, and legal violations.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_cert
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes a CERT policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_cwe_25_2019
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes the 2019 CWE Top 25 policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_cwe_25_2020
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes the 2020 CWE Top 25 policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_cwe_25_2022
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes the Auto-Update CWE Top 25 policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_owasp_2017
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes an OWASP 2017 policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_owasp_2021
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes an Auto-Update OWASP policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: cwes_owasp_mobile
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This table lists all the CWEs that may cause an application to not pass a policy that includes an OWASP Mobile policy rule.

results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.title: README
results_reports/review_methodology/cwes_.description: This appendix lists all the CWEs that violate the security standards you can apply to your policies in the Veracode Platform. It also indicates which CWEs are supported by Veracode Static Analysis and Dynamic Analysis. Veracode Manual Penetration Testing scans may report any valid CWE, including those not listed here.

results_reports/review_methodology/polic.title: policy_evaluation
results_reports/review_methodology/polic.description: The Policy Evaluation section of the Results page provides an overview of how the application fared against its associated policy.

results_reports/review_methodology/READM.title: README
results_reports/review_methodology/READM.description: Veracode provides a unique methodology with its Static Analysis and Dynamic Analysis products to identify security flaws in applications.

results_reports/review_methodology/revie.title: reviewing_flaw_sources
results_reports/review_methodology/revie.description: The flaw sources report quickly identifies main sources of untrusted data in an application and locates all the flaws that share a flaw source.

results_reports/review_methodology/scori.title: scoring_methodology
results_reports/review_methodology/scori.description: The Veracode scoring system, Security Quality Score, is built on the foundation of two industry standards, the Common Weakness Enumeration \(CWE\) and Common Vulnerability Scoring System \(CVSS\). CWE provides the dictionary of security flaws and CVSS provides the foundation for computing severity, based on the potential Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability impact of a flaw, if exploited.

results_reports/review_methodology/under.title: understanding_severity_exploitability_effort
results_reports/review_methodology/under.description: Severity and exploitability are two different measurements of the seriousness of a finding. Effort to Fix measures the complexity of the work required to fix the finding.

results_reports/review_methodology/under.title: understanding_veracode_and_cwe
results_reports/review_methodology/under.description: Veracode references the Common Weakness Enumeration \(CWE\) standard to map the flaws found in its static and dynamic scans.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: matching_filenames_scans
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: The Veracode Platform attempts to match uploaded application files that appear to be related to a source file, but may have different build or version numbers. By matching these files, Veracode can track flaws across different builds without falsely reporting any new flaws because the name of the container changes between scans.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: README
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: The triage flaws task allows you to review static flaws in the context of their local copy of the source code for the application. This section describes static flaws and explains how to:

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: reviewing_module_selection
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: If you have scanned an application before, you can view the differences between the files you uploaded last time, and the files you uploaded this time. This view allows you to verify you are reviewing the same files as the previous upload. For the most consistent results, Veracode recommends that you scan the same files between scans.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: use_source_code_view
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: The Source Code view allows you to load source code from your local system,or a network-accessible directory, into Triage Flaws so that you can view information about the flaw in the context of your original source.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: using_TSRV_format
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: TSRV \(Technique, Specifics, Remaining Risk, and Verification\) is a recommended standard format for mitigation proposals that makes it easy for security teams to understand and accept mitigation proposals from development teams.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: video_review_static_flaws
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: Watch the following video to learn how to:

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: view_data_path_info_flaws
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: You can view all paths through the code that lead to the sink, the exploitable point where a flaw is expressed, from a link on the Triage Flaws page.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: view_flaws_nondebug_code
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: The Veracode Platform allows you to view flaws found in code without debug symbols. Since source file and line number information is unavailable for these flaws, Veracode Provides other location information.

results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.title: view_static_results_application
results_reports/review_static_flaw_viewe.description: To access static results, from the Application Overview page of the application, click Triage Flaws under the application name. Then, click Static under the application name, if it is not already selected.

results_reports/reviewing_scan_results/c.title: c_video_reviewing_scan_results
results_reports/reviewing_scan_results/c.description: Watch this video to learn how to view Veracode scan results in the Veracode Platform.

results_reports/reviewing_scan_results/R.title: README
results_reports/reviewing_scan_results/R.description: The Results page provides a single point of reference for the results of all completed scans. From this page you can download reports, bookmark reports, and schedule a consultation call with Veracode Technical Support.

results_reports/understanding_mpt_result.title: understanding_mpt_results
results_reports/understanding_mpt_result.description: The Veracode Platform can generate a report that includes manual assessment results, usually from Veracode Manual Penetration Testing (MPT) or a code review. These results differ from the results of automated scans in several important ways, including objectives, attack values, and common attack patterns.

results_reports/understanding_scan_resul.title: understanding_scan_results
results_reports/understanding_scan_resul.description: During security scanning, Veracode uses specific methodologies and techniques to determine the overall security score of your applications. Veracode provides the scan results in various reports, which you can review to understand the security of your applications and to determine the next steps for addressing security findings.

results_reports/view_accelerated_results.title: view_accelerated_results_for_static
results_reports/view_accelerated_results.description: Veracode publishes static scan results incrementally by top-level module so that you can begin reviewing your results while the remainder of your application is scanned.

Sandbox/c_about_sandbox_data_expiration.title: c_about_sandbox_data_expiration
Sandbox/c_about_sandbox_data_expiration.description: Veracode archives information about expired sandboxes and scans before deleting these sandboxes and scans.

Sandbox/c_about_sandbox/c_sandbox_data_r.title: c_sandbox_data_retention
Sandbox/c_about_sandbox/c_sandbox_data_r.description: Veracode retires data in sandboxes based on the data retention setting that you apply at the account level.

Sandbox/c_about_sandbox/README.title: README
Sandbox/c_about_sandbox/README.description: Development sandboxes allow individual contributors and teams to scan applications and measure the results against the policy rules. These scans do not affect the policy compliance of the entire application.

Sandbox/c_mitigate_sandbox.title: c_mitigate_sandbox
Sandbox/c_mitigate_sandbox.description: You can mitigate flaws found in sandbox scans.

Sandbox/t_create_sandbox.title: t_create_sandbox
Sandbox/t_create_sandbox.description: You can create a sandbox to provide a temporary store of your security analysis of an application.

Sandbox/t_download_sandbox_activity.title: t_download_sandbox_activity
Sandbox/t_download_sandbox_activity.description: You can download a report from the Veracode Platform that provides detailed activity for a sandbox.

Sandbox/t_promote_sandbox.title: t_promote_sandbox
Sandbox/t_promote_sandbox.description: After completing a sandbox scan, you have the option to promote the sandbox scan to a policy scan that counts toward your policy compliance score. You can perform a sandbox scan as part of integration testing to validate the security of your application and, then, promote the sandbox scan to a policy scan.

Sandbox/t_review_sandbox_scan_results.title: t_review_sandbox_scan_results
Sandbox/t_review_sandbox_scan_results.description: You can access the results from sandbox scans to review the findings.

Sandbox/t_start_a_sandbox_scan.title: t_start_a_sandbox_scan
Sandbox/t_start_a_sandbox_scan.description: You can start a scan of an existing sandbox to measure the results against policy rules.

Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/c_about.title: c_about_jenkins_sandbox
Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/c_about.description: Within Jenkins, you can create a development sandbox into which you upload your files and, then, you can run a scan from the sandbox.

Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/c_intel.title: c_intelliJ_sandbox
Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/c_intel.description: Within IntelliJ, you create a development sandbox into which you upload your files and, then, you can run a scan from the sandbox.

Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/t_eclip.title: t_eclipse_sandbox
Sandbox/using_dev_sandboxes_ides/t_eclip.description: Within Eclipse, you create a development sandbox into which you upload your files and, then, you can run a scan from the sandbox.

SCA/about_sca_upload_scans.title: about_sca_upload_scans
SCA/about_sca_upload_scans.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) helps you build an inventory of your third-party components to identify vulnerabilities, including open-source and commercial code.

SCA/agent_based_scans/accessing_sca_agen.title: accessing_sca_agent_scanning_platform
SCA/agent_based_scans/accessing_sca_agen.description: Accessing Veracode SCA agent-based scanning from the Veracode Platform allows you to benefit from a robust Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\) solution that can directly integrate with your continuous integration (CI) pipeline.

SCA/agent_based_scans/add_teams_sca_work.title: add_teams_sca_workspace
SCA/agent_based_scans/add_teams_sca_work.description: By default, scan results for an agent-based scanning workspace are only visible to members of that workspace. To allow visibility, add teams to your workspace.

SCA/agent_based_scans/automate_security_.title: automate_security_checks_agent
SCA/agent_based_scans/automate_security_.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning integrates into the build process to prevent the delivery of insecure software to production. It easily integrates with your continuous delivery workflow.

SCA/agent_based_scans/create_sca_workspa.title: create_sca_workspace
SCA/agent_based_scans/create_sca_workspa.description: Workspaces help you organize your project data for Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning. Use workspaces to organize scan results by application or business unit.

SCA/agent_based_scans/explore_vulnerabil.title: explore_vulnerability_database
SCA/agent_based_scans/explore_vulnerabil.description: The Veracode Vulnerability Database contains all the public CVEs and exclusive vulnerability content that is not available elsewhere. The majority of vulnerabilities added to the Veracode Vulnerability Database are exclusive to Veracode, not CVEs.

SCA/agent_based_scans/using_agent_scanni.title: using_agent_scanning_reports
SCA/agent_based_scans/using_agent_scanni.description: Scan reports help you identify and resolve security issues in your applications.

SCA/generating_sbom_agent.title: generating_sbom_agent
SCA/generating_sbom_agent.description: You can use the Veracode SCA Agent REST API to generate a software bill of materials (SBOM) based on your latest Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scan results.

SCA/generating_sbom_upload_scans.title: generating_sbom_upload_scans
SCA/generating_sbom_upload_scans.description: You can use the Veracode SCA Agent REST API to generate a software bill of materials (SBOM) based on the latest results from your Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scans or agent-based scans that you have linked to an application profile.

SCA/getting_started_sca/choose_sca_scan_.title: choose_sca_scan_type
SCA/getting_started_sca/choose_sca_scan_.description: The Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) scan types provide distinct benefits depending on how you use them. This section provides some guidelines to help you determine which scan type is best for your use cases.

SCA/getting_started_sca/integrating_sca_.title: integrating_sca_with_tools
SCA/getting_started_sca/integrating_sca_.description: You can integrate Veracode Software Composition Analysis with several CI/CD and ticketing tools.

SCA/getting_started_sca/link_sca_project.title: link_sca_projects_applications
SCA/getting_started_sca/link_sca_project.description: You can link the projects you create for Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scans to your Veracode Platform application profiles to enable a unified view of your results for all Veracode scans and include agent-based scan results in your application policy evaluations.

SCA/getting_started_sca/README.title: README
SCA/getting_started_sca/README.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) helps you build an inventory of your third-party components to identify vulnerabilities, including open-source and commercial code.

SCA/getting_started_sca/requesting_sca_u.title: requesting_sca_upload_scan
SCA/getting_started_sca/requesting_sca_u.description: These sections describe the necessary steps for requesting a Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan through the Static Analysis workflow.

SCA/getting_started_sca/start_first_sca_.title: start_first_sca_agent_scan
SCA/getting_started_sca/start_first_sca_.description: With Veracode SCA agent-based scans, you can start scanning your projects to find vulnerabilities. When you scan a project, you can generate a report that tells you about libraries and vulnerabilities in your projects.

SCA/getting_started_sca/understanding_sc.title: understanding_sca_roles
SCA/getting_started_sca/understanding_sc.description: This table lists the roles you must have in the Veracode Platform to complete specific actions in Veracode Software Composition Analysis.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.title: README
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.description: Veracode recommends that you comply with the best practices to make the most effective use of Veracode Software Composition Analysis.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.title: sca_best_practices_for_cicd
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.description: Veracode recommends that you follow these best practices to effectively implement Veracode Software Composition Analysis in your automated CI/CD projects.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.title: sca_best_practices_for_compliance
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_best_pract.description: Veracode recommends that you follow these best practices to effectively use Veracode Software Composition Analysis to review the security policy compliance of your code before releasing it to production.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.title: about_supported_languages_agent
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning integrates with many build systems. This section provides a list of the package managers and integrations that agent-based scanning supports.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.title: README
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis features are available for several programming languages, which all have specific requirements for performing scans.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.title: understanding_language_support_upload
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_progra.description: To upload and scan with Veracode Software Composition Analysis, your application must meet the packaging requirements for the relevant supported language.

SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_rest_a.title: using_sca_rest_apis
SCA/getting_started_sca/using_sca_rest_a.description: You can use the Veracode REST APIs to performs tasks for Veracode SCA upload scans and agent-based scans.

SCA/getting_started_sca/video_set_up_age.title: video_set_up_agent_to_scan_sca
SCA/getting_started_sca/video_set_up_age.description: Watch this video to learn how to:

SCA/getting_started_sca/video_upload_and.title: video_upload_and_scan_sca
SCA/getting_started_sca/video_upload_and.description: Watch the following video to learn how to upload and scan applications with Veracode Software Composition Analysis.

SCA/images/c_integrated_packaging_requir.title: About Supported Languages for SCA Upload Scans {#c_integrated_packaging_requirements .concept}

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/preparing.title: preparing_application_sca_upload_scanning
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/preparing.description: Veracode Packaging Requirements provides detailed compilation and packaging steps to allow for optimal analysis for all the Veracode SCA supported languages.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/README.title: README
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/README.description: These sections describe the necessary steps for requesting a Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan through the Static Analysis workflow.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/request_s.title: request_static_scan_configure_options_sca
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/request_s.description: You can request a static scan and configure the scan options to start the process of performing a Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/scan_stat.title: scan_statuses_sca_upload_scans
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/scan_stat.description: The Veracode Platform displays the status of your Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scans.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/select_mo.title: select_modules_sca_upload_scanning
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/select_mo.description: You can select top-level modules to include in your Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan after prescan verification completes.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/start_sca.title: start_sca_upload_scan
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/start_sca.description: After requesting a Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan and uploading your application, you can start the scan.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/understan.title: understanding_prescan_verification_sca_upload
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/understan.description: Veracode performs a prescan verification after uploading your application for analysis. The prescan verification performs an initial analysis of the application to verify that you have packaged the application correctly for Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scanning.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/upload_pa.title: upload_packaged_application_upload_sca
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/upload_pa.description: You must upload a packaged application to Veracode to perform a Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scan.

SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/upload_sc.title: upload_scan_language_matrix
SCA/requesting_sca_upload_scan/upload_sc.description: This table identifies the supported versions and package managers for each programming language that Veracode Software Composition Analysis upload scans support.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: configure_bamboo_repository
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: Bamboo is an on-premise CI system, which means you must install cURL on your server prior to running a Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scan.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: create_agent_token_atlassian_bamboo
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: By default, the agent you create is only visible to members of the workspace in which you created the agent. To allow visibility, invite teams to your workspace.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: README
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: You can set the Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning API token environment variable on an individual plan basis or globally within your Bamboo environment. You can also set the environment variable when you create the script command in your Bamboo task instead of setting it at the plan or global levels.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: To scan using Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning, add this YAML to the last default configuration script command in the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file:

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: create_agent_token_bitbucket
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: By default, the agent you create is only visible to members of the workspace in which you created the agent. To allow visibility, invite teams to your workspace.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: set_bitbucket_account_variable
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: You can set the environment variable for Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning at either the account or repository levels.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: set_bitbucket_repo_variable
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: Environment variables added on the repository level can be accessed by any users with the push permission in the repository. You can set a repository environment variable to perform scans on each new build.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: create_agent_token_circleci
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: By default, the agent you create is only visible to members of the workspace in which you created the agent. To allow visibility, invite teams to your workspace.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: set_circleci_environment_variable
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: You can set an environment variable for each repository you want to scan.

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: Steps

SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.title: configure_codeship_pro_project
SCA/setting_up_agent_based_scans/continu.description: Before You Begin

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/about_organi.title: about_organization_rules_agent

If your organization has configured organization rules but does not enforce them, you can select the organization rules when configuring the rules for a workspace.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: You can export the results of your agent-based scans as a CSV file. You can filter the results by scan date and by issue type.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: ignore_sca_issues
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning provides users with accurate, up-to-date vulnerability information, but not all issues apply to your code. For this reason, Veracode SCA allows you to suppress issues if you want to prevent them from causing your build

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Issues are the essential components of Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning. They allow you to track and take action on vulnerabilities, out-of-date libraries, and software licensing concerns for open-source libraries in a specific software project.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: understanding_sca_license_risk
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Before using third-party, open-source components, Veracode recommends you review the license and associated risk to understand the implications of using the component in your application.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: understanding_tags_branches_sca_agent
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning is designed to be used with Git-based systems. Within these systems, there are commits, branches, and tags. This section describes how these three items affect issues in agent-based scanning and how you can manage them.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: unignore_issue_sca
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: If you mistakenly ignored an issue or decide that an issue should now be tracked, you can unignore it.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: view_sca_issue_details
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Because issues uniquely relate to a specific library and version, the details for an issue make it much easier to fix.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.title: view_sca_vulnerability_details
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/issue_manage.description: Vulnerabilities represent the set of security concerns across a project or workspace. Viewing vulnerability details allows you to view information across all versions of a specific vulnerability, such as libraries in which the agent-based scan has found it.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/do.title: download_agent_sca_security_report
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/do.description: You can download a PDF report of your agent-based scan workspace findings that provides vulnerability statistics for your application.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/RE.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/RE.description: Libraries represent each open-source library that Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning has identified within a code project.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/un.title: understanding_agent_vulnerabilities
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/un.description: Veracode uses multiple data sources for vulnerabilities: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures \(CVE\) from the National Vulnerability Database \(NVD\), and Veracode vulnerabilities \(SRCCLR\) from the Veracode Vulnerability Database.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/un.title: unmatched_libraries
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/un.description: You can filter your library list to view the libraries found in your project that the Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning scan engine does not recognize.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/vi.title: view_library_details
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/libraries/vi.description: Viewing library details allows you to collect a wide variety of information, including vulnerable version ranges for the library, other libraries that could be subject to particular vulnerabilities, and resources for finding more information.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: add_webhook_project
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: You can configure the payload URL and trigger events of the webhook notifications for your Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) projects.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: change_default_branch_sca_agent
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: You can set a specific branch as the default branch for your project or use the most recently scanned branch or tag.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: delete_sca_project

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: enable_notifications_watched_projects
