SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: understanding_default_branches_agent_projects
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: The default branch for your Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scan projects determines which data to display in the Veracode Platform. It also specifies the branch in which Veracode automatically creates issues for newly released vulnerabilities.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: understanding_webhooks
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: A webhook allows Veracode Software Composition Analysis to notify you when certain events occur in your project. When the event is triggered, Veracode sends an HTTP POST request with a payload to your configured URL.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: view_sca_project_history
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis provides a history of scan results for your projects that allows you to review how your issues have changed since you created the project.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.title: watching_sca_project
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/project_mana.description: On the Project Details page in the Veracode Platform, there is an option to watch a project.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.title: create_sca_agents
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.description: For information on creating agents with the SCA Agent REST API, see Using the Veracode SCA Agent REST API.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.title: delete_sca_agents
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.description: For information on deleting agents with the SCA Agent REST API, see Using the Veracode SCA Agent REST API.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.description: The Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent, also referred to as the scanner, is the program that builds and scans your code to find third-party libraries and the vulnerabilities contained in those libraries.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.title: regenerate_sca_agent_token
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.description: To connect to your organization during scanning, Veracode SCA uses an agent authentication token, which acts as a password.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.title: view_workspace_agents
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/sca_agent_ma.description: For information on viewing agents with the SCA Agent REST API, see Using the Veracode SCA Agent REST API.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/scan_directi.title: automatic_pr_scan_directives
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/scan_directi.description: You can use these scan directives to configure when Veracode SCA automatically generates a pull request.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/scan_directi.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/scan_directi.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agents support scans that include per-scan directives, known as scan directives. To specify these scan directives on a per-project basis, include a srcclr.yml file at the root of the scan.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.title: understanding_agent_evidence
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.description: Because the scanning process consists of building the code to be scanned, generating a dependency graph from the built code, and identifying libraries used with the dependency graph, Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning requires the source code of the repository you want to scan in order to function properly. Libraries are identified by sending information to Veracode to match against the Veracode database. This section provides details on what information is sent from your environment to Veracode.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.title: understanding_deployment_agent
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning is a set of technologies that helps teams use open-source safely while building secure software. The solution integrates transparently into the existing software development process with minimal change or impact. The agent-based scanning platform has a number of options to choose from and each option is designed for specific use cases. A typical deployment consists of a combination of these options, which you can choose to fit your team structure, team process, and existing toolchain.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.title: understanding_sca_workspaces
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/understandin.description: You can create workspaces to separate and manage project scan data. Each workspace can include multiple Veracode Software Composition Analysis agents that perform scans on your code projects and display the results in the workspace to which they belong. You can store scan data in different workspaces and control user access to that data based on the workspaces to which a user belongs.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/use_latest_c.title: use_latest_cvss_version_sca_rules
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/use_latest_c.description: You can use Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) version 3 in your agent-based scanning rules to evaluate your vulnerabilities against the latest version of the standard.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.title: add_teams_workspace
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.description: Adding teams to a Veracode SCA workspace gives the members of those teams access to the projects in that workspace.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.description: For organizations with many users, it can be difficult to manage direct assignments. Teams can alleviate this manual work by providing a container for users who require the same level of access to the same workspaces. Add the teams to the right workspaces with the desired role, and all users in the team automatically inherit those permissions. When one person changes teams, remove the user from the old team and assign the user to the new team.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.title: remove_teams_workspace
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/user_managem.description: Removing teams from a Veracode SCA workspace prevents the members of those teams from accessing the projects in that workspace.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_my_wor.title: using_my_workspace_sca
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_my_wor.description: All Veracode Software Composition Analysis users have access to a personal workspace for local scanning, called My Workspace. You can use this workspace to quickly experiment with agent-based scanning and test changes to your code without affecting the pipeline builds or compliance status of your projects.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: auto_pull_request_language_support
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: This table lists which GitHub and GitLab projects support automatic pull requests.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: configure_agent_auto_pull_requests
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: You configure parameters of automatic pull requests in your Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: enable_pull_requests_github
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: To use automatic pull requests for Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scanning, you need permission to create pull requests in GitHub.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: enable_pull_requests_gitlab
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: To use automatic pull requests for Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning, you need permission to create merge requests in GitLab.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: README
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent-based scanning supports automatically generating pull requests of GitHub and GitLab repositories to fix vulnerabilities identified in agent scans.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: troubleshooting_auto_prs
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: If the Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent is not able to generate an automatic pull request, it displays this message: No pull request was generated.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: video_enable_pull_requests_github
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: Watch this short video to learn how to enable pull requests in GitHub so that you can use automatic pull requests for use with Veracode SCA agent-based scans.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: video_enable_pull_requests_gitlab
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: Watch this short video to learn how to enable merge requests in GitLab so that you can use automatic pull requests for use with Veracode SCA agent-based scans.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: video_update_advisor_agent_auto_prs
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: Watch this short video to learn how to:

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: configure_update_advisor_sca
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: The update advisor provides a safe version to which Veracode recommends you update your libraries with agent-based scanning. If you configure it in your build automation script, it also indicates if the update might break a build.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: enable_agent_behind_proxy
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: If you use the Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent with a CI tool that is behind a proxy, you must establish communication between the agent and your proxy server.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: use_agent_scm_other
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: You can use the Veracode SCA agent to scan a repository that uses a source code management (SCM) system other than Git. You can use these instructions to configure all commonly used SCM systems, including Subversion (SVN), Mercurial, and Team Foundation Version Control (TFVC).

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: using_agent_ci_script
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: You can add commands and environment variables to the script in your continuous integration tool to customize your Veracode Software Composition Analysis agent-based scans.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: veracode_sca_agent_commands
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: This section lists the primary commands you can use with the Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent, as well as arguments you can add to alter the functionality of each command.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: veracode_sca_agent_config_values
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: You configure these key names for agent-based scanning in the agent.yml file, which is created when you activate the Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent.

SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.title: veracode_sca_agent_env_variables
SCA/using_agent_based_scans/using_sca_ag.description: The Veracode Software Composition Analysis (SCA) agent can read from these environment variables instead of variables set in the agent.yml file.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: about_sca_remediation_guidance
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: These guidelines can help you lower your application risk in Veracode Software Composition Analysis.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: address_sca_vulnerabilties
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You can take mitigation actions to temporarily address the vulnerabilities found in the latest Veracode Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\) scan of your application.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: approve_reject_sca_mitigations
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You can approve or reject mitigations that members of your team propose for component licenses or vulnerabilities.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: export_sca_portfolio_results
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: With Veracode Software Composition Analysis, you can export and download the SCA scan results for each application in your application portfolio.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: include_sca_findings_in_policy
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You can restrict an application from using vulnerable third-party components by adding  requirements to your policy. You can also enforce that the application must not exceed maximum CVSS scores or license risk and must meet grace period requirements to pass policy.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: meeting_sca_policy_compliance
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: From Application > Software Composition Analysis in the Veracode Platform, you can view which of your components are passing or failing the security requirements outlined by the Software Composition Analysis (SCA) policy rules.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: mitigate_license_risk_sca
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You can take mitigation actions to temporarily address license risks found in Veracode Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\).

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: mitigating_sca_vulnerabilities_licenses
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You can review vulnerabilities and licenses found during Veracode Software Composition Analysis \(SCA\) to decide if you want to address them temporarily using mitigation actions.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: README
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: You may want to review your application portfolio to determine which applications are passing or failing policy.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: reviewing_sca_license_data
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: Before using third-party, open-source components, Veracode recommends you review the license and associated risk to understand the implications of using the component in your application.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: using_application_data_sca
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: The Applications tab provides a portfolio view of the vulnerability status of your applications and whether the applications are meeting the associated policies. The list of applications indicates who submitted the scan and the level of severity for each of the vulnerabilities found.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: using_cvss_versions
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: Veracode Software Composition Analysis supports applying version 2 or version 3 of the Common Vulnerability Scoring System \(CVSS\) to your policies. The version you apply can impact whether a finding from an SCA scan causes your application to fail policy.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: using_third_party_components_data
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: The Third-Party Components tab lists all the third-party components in your applications, and provides version, usage, license risk, and known vulnerability information.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: using_vulnerabilities_data_sca
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: The Vulnerabilities tab in the Veracode Platform lists all the vulnerabilities in your portfolio by CVE and severity rating.

SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.title: veracode_sca_legal_disclaimer
SCA/using_veracode_sca_upload_scan_resul.description: Veracode, Inc. (Veracode) does not provide legal advice. Please be aware that your use of the Veracode solution does not serve as a substitute for your compliance with any applicable laws (including but not limited to any act, statute, regulation, rule, directive, standard, policy, administrative order, or executive order (collectively, (Laws))) or any contractual obligations with any third parties. You are responsible for consulting an independent legal counsel regarding any such Laws or contractual obligations. Use of the Veracode solution does not serve as a substitute for your own assessment of business risks associated with the software licenses identified by Veracode.

Security_Labs/assign_seclabs_roles/admin.title: README

Security_Labs/assign_seclabs_roles/assig.title: assign_roles
Security_Labs/assign_seclabs_roles/assig.description: You can assign user and manager roles to existing Security Labs users.

Security_Labs/assign_seclabs_roles/creat.description: You can create custom user roles to group users by a distinct category, such as job function, software language, department, or project. You can then report on users by groups.

Security_Labs/c_about_sec_labs_community.title: c_about_sec_labs_community_edition

Security_Labs/create_camp_auto/t_create_.description: You can manually create a campaign that contains one or more lab assignments. You can assign a campaign to one or more roles.

Security_Labs/create_users/add_user_plat.title: add_user_platform
Security_Labs/create_users/add_user_plat.description: You can create new Security Labs users from the Administration page in the Veracode Platform.

Security_Labs/create_users/bulk_assign_i.description: You can assign differing user roles to individual Security Labs users when you bulk upload new users in a CSV file. You can bulk upload a maximum of 100 users per upload.

Security_Labs/create_users/bulk_upload_a.title: bulk_upload_assign_roles
Security_Labs/create_users/bulk_upload_a.description: You can assign all your Security Labs users the same user roles when you bulk upload new users in a CSV file. You can bulk upload a maximum of 100 users per upload.

Security_Labs/create_users/c_video_creat.description: Watch this video to learn how to create Security Labs users from the Veracode Platform.

Security_Labs/create_users/c_video_creat.description: Watch this video to learn how to create users from within the Security Labs interface.

Security_Labs/create_users/create_user_s.description: You can use the SSO SAML gateway of your organization to create Security Labs users automatically. Any users who make an authenticated SSO login request from an email address with a matching domain automatically register and join your account.

Security_Labs/create_users/README.title: README
Security_Labs/create_users/README.description: You can create new Security Labs users these two ways:

Security_Labs/customize/create_labs.description: You can create Security Labs lessons using Security Labs as a sandbox. Veracode can provide you with a template to help you create a lesson, or you can create a lesson from scratch.

Security_Labs/customize/edit_labs.description: You can edit the lessons in your Security Labs modules.

Security_Labs/getting_started/README.title: README
Security_Labs/getting_started/README.description: As the administrator, you are the contact person in your organization for all Security Labs questions and information. Veracode creates the first Security Labs user account for your organization. You use this account as the Security Labs administrator.

Security_Labs/t_assign_learning_paths.description: You can configure campaigns to automatically forward a user from one assignment to another.

Security_Labs/t_email_progress_notificat.title: t_email_progress_notifications
Security_Labs/t_email_progress_notificat.description: You can configure Security Labs to automatically send email notifications on a specified schedule within a campaign or assignment. Notifications inform team managers about team progress or notify users that they have one or more incomplete assignments in the campaign.

Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.description: You can enable Security Labs users to contact teammates who already completed labs they are working on. You can enable contact by email, MS Teams, and Slack.

Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.title: enable_certification_badge
Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.description: You can enable your developers to earn level 1, 2, and 3 certification badges when they complete 100, 200, and 300 points worth of labs, respectively.

Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.description: If a campaign is set to competition mode, Security Labs users compete against each other on a separate leaderboard for that campaign. Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.title: view_share_certification_badge
Security_Labs/using_teams_and_leaderboar.description: You can view and share your certification progress.

Security_Labs/view_the_security_labs_rep.title: c_video_report_on_user_progress_security_labs
Security_Labs/view_the_security_labs_rep.description: Watch this video to learn how to report on user progress in Veracode Security Labs and the API.

Security_Labs/view_the_security_labs_rep.title: README
Security_Labs/view_the_security_labs_rep.description: You use the Reporting page to view information about how people are using Security Labs. The page consists of a dashboard with sections that report on different metrics.

Static/data_retention.title: data_retention
Static/data_retention.description: Veracode retains your uploaded binaries according to specific rules.

Static/errors_master.title: errors_master

Static/getting_started_static/edit_appli.title: edit_application_profile
Static/getting_started_static/edit_appli.description: You can edit the data in the application profile at any point in the scan process. You can also edit an application profile with the Applications API.

Static/getting_started_static/README.title: README
Static/getting_started_static/README.description: Veracode Static Analysis is a Static Application Security Testing \(SAST\) solution that enables you to quickly identify and remediate application security findings. It analyzes major frameworks and languages without requiring source code, so you can assess the code you write, buy, or download, and measure progress in a single platform.

Static/getting_started_static/request_pr.title: request_profile
Static/getting_started_static/request_pr.description: The application profile describes your application, identifies the policy with which to evaluate the application, and provides metadata that enables a thorough analysis of security performance across all the applications in your organization.

Static/getting_started_static/static_nex.title: static_nextsteps
Static/getting_started_static/static_nex.description: After you have performed a static scan, here is what you can do next:

Static/getting_started_static/workflow_s.title: workflow_scan
Static/getting_started_static/workflow_s.description: These topics describe the sequence for requesting a static scan:

Static/request_static_scan_options.title: request_static_scan_options
Static/request_static_scan_options.description: You can begin the process of requesting a static scan from the Applications page.

Static/request_status/delete_completed_s.title: delete_completed_scan
Static/request_status/delete_completed_s.description: You can use the Veracode Platform to delete a Static Analysis policy scan that completes successfully.

Static/request_status/delete_scan_reques.title: delete_scan_request
Static/request_status/delete_scan_reques.description: You can delete scans while they are in progress.

Static/request_status/download_scan_acti.title: download_scan_activity
Static/request_status/download_scan_acti.description: You can download a report from the Veracode Platform that provides detailed activity for an application.

Static/request_status/progress_scans_pag.title: progress_scans_page
Static/request_status/progress_scans_pag.description: You can select the In Progress view to obtain the status of all applications that Veracode is currently scanning.

Static/request_status/README.title: README
Static/request_status/README.description: You can return to the Veracode Platform at any time to check your scans, review detailed information about the status of a scan, or delete a scan request.

Static/view_changes_file_uploads.description: For the most consistent results, Veracode recommends that you scan the same files between scans. ticketing/azure_devops_extension/README.description: Veracode provides an extension for Azure DevOps and Team Foundation Server (TFS). You can use the extension to automatically import flaws and vulnerabilities as work items. Veracode discovers flaws during Static Analysis scans and vulnerabilities during Dynamic Analysis or Software Composition Analysis (SCA) scans.

ticketing/azure_devops_extension/use_cus.title: use_custom_flaw_templates_azure
ticketing/azure_devops_extension/use_cus.description: You can use custom process templates to automatically import flaws and vulnerabilities as work items into Azure DevOps or Team Foundation Server (TFS).

You can use the integration to import findings from Veracode into Bugzilla. You can then manage the findings as defects in Bugzilla. This integration is based on standard Bugzilla configuration settings for priority, severity, and other values.

ticketing/jira_cloud_integration/configu.description: You configure the Veracode Integration for Jira Cloud to specify the findings identified during Veracode scanning to import into Jira Cloud.

ticketing/jira_cloud_integration/configu.description: After installing the integration, you configure it to add your Veracode credentials for accessing the Veracode Platform and to set up your findings import settings.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: Access to Veracode requires a Veracode Platform account. Your local Veracode Administrator or your Veracode Account Manager can create the account and send you an account activation email.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: choosing_scan_type
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: Veracode offers application scans as an integral part of any company-wide security policy. You can use Veracode to enforce consistent application security policies across your entire inventory of applications, both those that you develop and third-party applications.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: dynamic_analysis_overview
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: The Dynamic Analysis scan overview page in the Veracode Platform provides at-a-glance information for the latest Dynamic Analysis.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: getstarted_app_risk_management
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: Veracode is the only on-demand provider in the marketplace to offer a full application risk management solution. This solution includes an application inventory definition and an application security policy that provides multiple analysis methods and standard security ratings.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: managing_app_portfolio
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: The Veracode Platform enables you to manage all the applications in the portfolio for your organization. One of the first tasks you perform in the Veracode Platform is to input all the information about the applications that you want to analyze.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: navigate_app_menu_platform
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: The Application section of the left navigation menu links you to the Application Overview page, the application profile page, and the metadata page.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: README
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: If you are new to application security testing or want to run your first scan with minimal setup, try scanning using the Veracode Platform.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: static_scan_overview
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: The static scan overview page in the Veracode Platform provides at-a-glance information for the latest Static Analysis.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: README
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: Welcome to the Veracode Documentation website! If you are new to Veracode or application security testing, this Getting Started section explains how to gain access to Veracode and provides links to resources for learning about Veracode products and testing the security of your applications.

tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.title: selecting_products
tile_getting_started/geting_started_vera.description: Veracode provides several products that you can use to identify security issues in your application code, assess the overall security of your applications, and learn about security testing.

tile_getting_started/glossary.title: glossary
tile_getting_started/glossary.description: This glossary provides definitions for general application security terms and terms specific to Veracode products.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/abo.title: about_community
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/abo.description: You can use the Veracode Community to connect with peers and Veracode subject matter experts for support, to learn best practices, and to collaborate on how Veracode products and services can work better for you.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/abo.title: about_user_entity_controls
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/abo.description: Veracode takes responsibility for ensuring that your information is kept secure when it is under the control of Veracode. Some parts of Veracode products and solutions depend on your organizational administrative control or rely on infrastructure installed in the environment in your organization. Therefore, you are responsible for implementing additional controls related to your use of Veracode products.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/acc.title: access_community_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/acc.description: You can access the Veracode Community, including the content and features exclusive to Veracode users, directly through the Veracode Platform.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/acc.title: account_auth_notifications_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/acc.description: Veracode sends email notifications when you activate and authenticate your Veracode Platform account.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/boo.title: bookmarking_reports_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/boo.description: You can bookmark scan results reports in the Veracode Platform for easy retrieval. Bookmarked reports provide a snapshot of flaws and policy compliance at a specific point in time.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/bro.title: browse_apps_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/bro.description: The All Applications page shows a list of the application profiles to which you have access. You can view information about the applications, view older scans, find applications, view statuses, and check next actions for applications.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/bro.title: browser_reqs_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/bro.description: Veracode designs the Veracode Platform for these browser configurations:

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/cha.title: change_security_question_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/cha.description: You can change the security question that Veracode requires you to answer when you forget your password and attempt to reset it.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/con.title: contact_support_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/con.description: If you experience a major issue or error that affects your ability to complete tasks in the Veracode Platform, you can create a ticket so that Veracode can assist you.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/cre.title: create_custom_metadata_fields_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/cre.description: You can create your own custom field labels, which you can use to add specific metadata fields to your application profile. You can create up to 25 custom fields and delete the fields at any time.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/exp.title: export_data_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/exp.description: You can generate and download reports of your Veracode account data for analyzing your application security program.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/man.title: manage_app_metadata_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/man.description: Metadata provides detailed information about the application to enable you to analyze the security performance of all the applications in your portfolio. Use the metadata to group and sort your portfolio data by any of the standard categories to measure performance and policy compliance across the portfolio. Use the custom fields to create metadata fields of your own.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.title: completed_scans
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.description: From the Completed Scans you can see a list of all the scans that have finished.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.title: in_progress_scans
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.description: From the In Progress Scans page in the Veracode Platform you can see all the scans that are currently in progress.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.title: README
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/pla.description: The left navigation menu in the Veracode Platform is your key point of reference when moving between the application profile, scan requests, and scan results. The left navigation menu is always visible while you are working with applications and scans. The menu is collapsible for you to hide at any time by using the tab at the top of the menu.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/REA.title: README
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/REA.description: Learn the basics around using the Veracode Platform to manage your application security program.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.title: README
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.description: You can reset your password if you forget it, you get locked out of your account, the password expires, or an Administrator requests a reset.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.title: reset_expiring_password
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.description: You must change your password every 90 days. If your password is expiring soon, you receive a notification in the Veracode Platform informing you when it will expire.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.title: reset_forgotten_password
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.description: If you forget the password for your Veracode account, you can reset it.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.title: reset_password_account_locked
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.description: To protect your account from brute-force attacks, Veracode automatically locks your account for 30 minutes after 5 failed attempts to enter a correct password. Veracode sends an email informing you that your account is locked.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.title: reset_password_admin_request
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/res.description: If an Administrator requests that you change your password, you must reset the password for your Veracode account.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/sub.title: subscribe_news_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/sub.description: By default, Veracode sends occasional emails announcing updates that may be relevant to users. In the Veracode Platform, you can configure subscriptions for additional emails announcing Veracode updates, such as new features or training.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/usi.title: using_file_exchange_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/usi.description: The file exchange is a secure, temporary location where you can quickly and safely download files that Veracode has shared with you. In addition, if your vendors are sharing scan results with you, these reports also appear here in the file exchange. Each individual file can be up to 2GB.

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/usi.title: using_passwords_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/usi.description: The Veracode Platform protects your data in numerous ways. One of the most important ways is by securing your login so that it is not vulnerable to password guessing or brute force attack. Veracode does this by:

tile_getting_started/platform_basics/ver.title: verify_email_address_platform
tile_getting_started/platform_basics/ver.description: Verifying the email address you use for your Veracode account improves security and allows you to access the Veracode Community directly from the Veracode Platform.

tile_getting_started/use_docs.title: use_docs
tile_getting_started/use_docs.description: You can use the Veracode user documentation to answer questions, solve problems, and learn about Veracode products and services.

tile_integrations/about_integrations.title: about_integrations
tile_integrations/about_integrations.description: Veracode integrations allow you to maximize the benefits of static and dynamic cloud-based security testing in your Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) workflows.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.title: configure_creds_file_mac_linux
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.description: You can configure a Veracode API credentials file on macOS or Linux and, optionally, run a command to restrict access to the file.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.title: configure_creds_file_variable_mac_linux
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.description: You can store your Veracode API credentials as environment variables on macOS, Linux, or UNIX. You can use either an API credentials file or environment variables, but not both.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.title: configure_creds_file_windows
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/configu.description: You can configure a Veracode API credentials file on Windows and, optionally, use encryption to secure the file.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/README.title: README
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/README.description: Some Veracode products require that you provide your Veracode API credentials using a Veracode API credentials file.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/video_c.title: video_configure_creds_file_mac_linux
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/video_c.description: Watch the following video to learn how to generate Veracode API credentials in the Veracode Platform and configure a Veracode API credentials file for storing your API credentials on macOS and Linux.

tile_integrations/api_creds_file/video_c.title: video_configure_creds_file_windows
tile_integrations/api_creds_file/video_c.description: Watch the following video to learn how to generate Veracode API credentials in the Veracode Platform and configure a Veracode API credentials file for storing your API credentials on Windows.

tile_integrations/api_creds/generate_api.title: generate_api_creds
tile_integrations/api_creds/generate_api.description: You must generate Veracode API credentials before you can use the APIs and some integrations.

tile_integrations/api_creds/README.title: README
tile_integrations/api_creds/README.description: Veracode accounts use Veracode API credentials to access the Veracode APIs and some integrations. Authenticating users with API credentials provides improved security and session management for accessing the APIs.

tile_integrations/api_creds/revoke_api_c.title: revoke_api_creds
tile_integrations/api_creds/revoke_api_c.description: You can always revoke Veracode API credentials, if necessary. By default, the Veracode API credentials expire after one calendar year, unless a Veracode administrator resets the expiration date.

tile_integrations/automate_analysis_inte.title: automate_analysis_integrations
tile_integrations/automate_analysis_inte.description: If you are using the Veracode integrations to automate Veracode Static Analysis or Veracode Software Composition Analysis of your applications, you must follow certain guidelines to ensure that your automations run successfully.

tile_integrations/docker_images.title: docker_images
tile_integrations/docker_images.description: Docker images are available for the Java API wrapper, Pipeline Scan, and for HMAC signing.

tile_training/README.title: README
tile_training/README.description: Veracode provides Veracode Security Labs and Veracode eLearning to help you and your development teams learn about application security.

tile_troubleshoot/README.title: README
tile_troubleshoot/README.description: You can use the troubleshooting information to help you resolve errors or issues with Veracode products.

tutorial-basics/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
tutorial-basics/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.title: Create a Blog Post
tutorial-basics/create-a-blog-post.description: Docusaurus creates a page for each blog post, but also a blog index page, a tag system, an RSS feed...

tutorial-basics/create-a-document.title: Create a Document
tutorial-basics/create-a-document.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

tutorial-basics/create-a-page.title: Create a Page
tutorial-basics/create-a-page.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.title: Deploy your site
tutorial-basics/deploy-your-site.description: Docusaurus is a static-site-generator (also called Jamstack).

tutorial-basics/markdown-features.title: Markdown Features
tutorial-basics/markdown-features.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.title: Manage Docs Versions
tutorial-extras/manage-docs-versions.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.
